See you another day !
title: Execellent

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text:
I have been here once before I left Sri Lanka for the UK. So, when I came to Sri Lanka on vacation, I was happy to stay at this hotel during the days I planned to spend in Colombo. The rooms are very nice and clean, and have everything you need. The hotel is located centrally in Colombo and has easy access to all major destinations which is a huge benefit. 

Over a period of 3 weeks, I stayed at the hotel for about 7 nights as I was travelling away from Colombo frequently. The staff was friendly and supportive. Niroshan and Rushani from the front desk were especially very helpful in my encounters with them. I thank them for their kind hospitality. Secondly, the food in the restaurant is also some of the best food I've had. Definitely recommend the room service here. 

One of the only things that I could suggest as an improvement is to have larger water bottles in the room. We ran out of the bottles quite regularly and had to call up housekeeping to refill them multiple times (to which they happily obliged, which is great!) 

All in all, ME Colombo is definitely good value for money. You also get access to a rooftop infinity pool and a bar. I was able to host a couple of my friends at the rooftop bar for a nice cold beer as well. P.S. The view of the Colombo skyline from the rooftop is amazing. You can also get this view with most of their Superior rooms. 

By this point, I was starting to feel like it was home. However, I tried checking in for another time (8th night in 3 weeks if my memory is accurate) but did not have the best experience. Maybe it's my fault that I didn't make a reservation. My plans are always so sudden, so I couldn't manage to book anything before. Regardless, when I arrived at the hotel to try and check in, I was given very conflicting information and potentially treated unfairly. I arrived a little earlier than the check-in time. The receptionist at the time communicated to me that I could get a room a little later once some of the guests check out and the rooms are cleaned. I was happy to wait and even offered my card to finalise the payment. She even said that she will try to get the room arranged for me sooner for an early check-in. At that point, she had to contact the manager to get the authorisation for a special rate that was offered to me since I was planning to come back multiple times during my 6-week stay in Sri Lanka. The manager then came in and checked some things, and suddenly told me that there is no availability. Was it because he didn't want to oblige to the rate I had before when the hotel had low occupancy and it was at high occupancy at the time? Or was it because I was wearing shorts and a t-shirt with flip flops because I drove all the way from Kandy? Or maybe it was a miscommunication and a misunderstanding. Regardless, it didn't feel right to us. Ultimately, we ended up going to a different hotel that we quite enjoyed
title: Great place and a very enjoyable stay. But having second thoughts right now.

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text:
Loved the hotel very much. Nice and beautiful. Peace and calm in the middle of Colombo. Loved the interior too. 

The rooms were spacious and had all the facilities that you wanted. Everywhere was nice and tidy giving a relaxing vibe. Food was delicious and was presented beautifully.  
Had a nice time in the infinity pool with the nice view of Colombo city. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Simas Ahmed from rooftop bar gave a great service and did his best to make sure that everyone out there had a nice time and got what they needed. So a big shout out to him. 
Definitely was worth coming. Wishing the best to the staff and hotel for the coming years!
title: A nice getaway

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text:
We’ve been regular guests at ME Colombo, and every stay feels just like coming home. The staff is incredibly friendly and welcoming, always making sure we’re comfortable and relaxed from the moment we arrive. The rooms are cozy and well-maintained — truly a space where we can unwind with ease.

The rooftop pool and bar are absolutely stunning! It’s the perfect place to enjoy a beautiful view while sipping on a refreshing drink.

A special thank you goes out to Mr. Rilwan, the Front Office Manager, for leading such a fantastic team. Every interaction with Aruna, Sithumini, Rushani, and our all-time favorite Niroshan is a pleasure — they consistently go above and beyond to check in on us and make our stay memorable.

Also, a huge shoutout to Gopi from housekeeping, who always adds that extra special touch to our room, and Suraj from the restaurant, who never fails to serve up amazing cocktails with a smile.

Thank you, ME Colombo, for always treating us like family. Looking forward to our next stay already!
title: A Home Away From Home – Consistently Wonderful!

placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Meditationszentrum auf der kleinen vorgelagerten Insel
text:
Großes und dennoch familiäres Hotel direkt am Strand. Als Single-Mom war ich super happy, dass mein Sohn im Kids Club immer wieder für ein paar Stunden sehr gut betreut war. Ein besonderer Dank geht an Navee, der sich rührend um die Kleinen gekümmert und viele kreative Ideen mit den Kindern verwirklicht hat. 

Das Essen war sehr gut und ich habe es tatsächlich geschafft, den Urlaubspfunden ein paar mal beim Wasser-Aerobic die Stirn zu bieten. Es gibt ein breites Animationsprogramm, aber kein „Muss“ zum Mitmachen, was ich sehr entspannt fand. 

Fast direkt gegenüber befindet sich eine kleine Insel mit einem wundervollen Meditationszentrum, wenn man mal nach einem ganz stillen Ort sucht.
title: Strandhotel, das keine Wünsche offen lässt

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Don Jako,
We are deeply moved by your detailed account of your stay with us.

Your glowing review fills us with immense pride.

We are delighted that you appreciated our distinctive architectural design and prime beachfront setting, complemented by our meticulously maintained grounds. Your recognition of our exceptional service standards warms our hearts, from the attentive front office team to our dedicated housekeeping staff who maintain pristine accommodations.

It brings us great satisfaction to know that our culinary offerings exceeded your expectations, with our diverse menu selections and outstanding dining atmosphere at both the Garden of Eden and Sippi venues. The passionate commitment of our food and beverage team, led by our talented chefs, truly shines through your words.

Your appreciation of our personalized care and attention to detail, especially regarding your partner's specific needs, exemplifies our dedication to creating memorable experiences for each guest. The warmth and professionalism of our entire team, from management to service staff, reflects our genuine commitment to hospitality excellence.

We eagerly await the pleasure of welcoming you back to your home away from home.
Best regards,

The Management
placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
text:
Every visit to The Eden Beruwala reminds me of the structure of the Captain's Bridge of the mighty Titanic or any large commercial vessel upon entering Eden Resort. This five-star establishment is truly remarkable, offering breathtaking views of the sea based on my observations. The resort is blessed with an eco-friendly environment and boasts a stunning beachfront surrounded by lush greenery, alongside the awe-inspiring sight of the beautiful sea and a hillside monastery that we enjoyed during our stay at Eden. 
The hotel lobby is impressive, spacious, and impeccably clean, presented in a highly attractive manner. The young team at the front office works diligently, and we must commend them for their professionalism, attention to detail, and willingness to assist at any time. We received a wonderfully warm welcome from the hotel staff, who ensured our comfort throughout our stay from the very first day at this lovely establishment. The treatment we received from the hotel team was exceptional, and the rooms assigned to us exceeded our expectations; they were beautifully presented, spotless, and equipped with all the necessary amenities. My partner required extra care during this trip, and the hotel team consistently ensured she felt happy and comfortable, helping even before we asked for it. In my personal experience, the resort team is truly a **GEM**. 
Thank you, Rohan, Yohan, and your exceptional team—an incredible group of individuals, professional in their roles and attentive to detail, always humble and kind. The remarkable aspect of this team is their ability to remember guest preferences, making it impressive to witness how they care for their guests at Eden; it is truly an extraordinary experience. 
The fantastic food and beverage team at the hotel acts and thinks in alignment with their operational leaders, demonstrating excellent training; they are incredibly friendly, professional in their service, polite, and always willing to help. The housekeeping team maintained our rooms in pristine condition and ensured the hotel lobby area was well-kept and spotless. The main restaurant, Garden of Eden/Sippi, a new dining venue, offers an outstanding selection of high-quality meals. We enjoyed Sri Lankan Lamp Rice at Sippi on our first night, which was delightful with generous portions; the food spread at the main restaurant during our repeated stay was consistently delicious. 
The dining area boasts a great atmosphere, with a positive vibe evident during meal times. The food is exceptional and served in a hygienic manner to all guests. I must emphasise that excellent vegetarian options were available for guests. The restaurant service was extraordinary, with staff members exhibiting exceptional attention to detail, all of whom were friendly and polite at all times. Once again, thank you to GM Rohan, his fantastic team Yohan, the wonderful front office staff, Suresh, and his charming food and beverage team, Chef Deepal, Viraj, and his terrific team of chefs, who treated us with kindness and politeness. 
The hotel staff were highly professional, caring, and attentive to detail at all times. The standout feature of this entire hotel team is their commitment to exceeding guest expectations, always ensuring you have a superbly relaxed and enjoyable experience.
title: A Truly Unforgettable Experience at Eden Resort – Feels Like Coming Home again

ownerResponse/text:
Sehr geehrte Anthi,

vielen Dank für Ihren Besuch und Ihre Rückmeldung.

Es erfüllt uns mit Freude, dass Sie erneut eine großartige Zeit in unserem Occidental Eden Beruwala erlebt haben.

Dennoch bedauern wir, dass unser Angebot am Nachmittag nicht ganz Ihren Erwartungen entsprochen hat und nehmen Ihre Anregung für Kaffee und Kuchen gerne auf. Zudem verstehen wir, dass die Eignung unseres Hotels für Familien mit Kindern subjektiv variieren kann und wir respektieren Ihre Meinung hierzu.

Wir freuen uns sehr, dass Sie die Großzügigkeit und Sauberkeit unserer Zimmer sowie den freundlichen und zuvorkommenden Service unseres Zimmerservicepersonals schätzen. Dass Reparaturen schnell und effizient durchgeführt werden, ist ein wichtiger Teil unseres Services, und wir sind stolz darauf, dass dies von Ihnen positiv hervorgehoben wurde. Ihr Lob an Mr. Lasantha vom Housekeeping wissen wir zu schätzen und werden es gerne weiterleiten.

Abschließend möchten wir Ihnen für die Anerkennung der Qualität unseres Essens und die positive Rückmeldung zu unseren Restaurant- und Barmitarbeitern danken. Das Wohl unserer Gäste liegt uns am Herzen und das regelmäßige Nachfragen, ob alles zu Ihrer Zufriedenheit ist, gehört zu unserem Standard. Die Empfehlung unserer All-Inclusive-Option freut uns besonders, da wir stets bestrebt sind, unseren Gästen ein hervorragendes Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis zu bieten.

Wir möchten Ihnen nochmals unseren Dank für diesen liebenswürdigen Bericht über unser Hotel aussprechen und freuen uns, Sie in Zukunft wieder bei uns begrüßen zu dürfen.
Mit freundlichen Grüßen,

The Management
placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Wer geren mal ein Bierchen oder ein Gläschen Wein trinken möchte, sollte all inclusiv buchen, da der Alkohol sehr teuer ist.
text:
Das Empfangspersonal – insbesondere Mr. Sujewa (Bell Desk), Mr. Roshan (Front Office) und Mr. Niroshan (Front Office Manager) – war jederzeit ansprechbar und sehr hilfsbereit bei allen Anliegen.
Die Zimmer sind geräumig und sehr sauber. Der Zimmerservice ist freundlich und zuvorkommend. Reparaturen werden umgehend durchgeführt und erledigt.
An dieser Stelle möchten wir uns besonders bei Mr. Lasantha vom Housekeeping für seinen engagierten Einsatz bedanken.

Das Essen ist gut, allerdings wäre es wünschenswert, am Nachmittag zusätzlich Kaffee und ein Stück Kuchen angeboten zu bekommen.
Der Restaurantkapitän Mr. Nuwan, Herr Tharusha Dilshan aus der Küche sowie Mr. Sangeeth (F&B Manager) erkundigten sich regelmäßig, ob alles zu unserer Zufriedenheit sei.

Auch die Poolbar ist hervorragend – das Personal dort ist ebenso stets freundlich und aufmerksam.

Einen Aufenthalt in diesem Hotel empfehlen wir vor allem mit der Option "All Inclusive", da alkoholische Getränke im Hotel – wie übrigens in ganz Sri Lanka – recht teuer sind.

Für Familien mit Kindern ist dieses Hotel unserer Meinung nach eher weniger geeignet.
title: Auch nach dem dritten Aufenthalt immer noch sehr schön.

placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka

title: Truly memorable ❤️

placeInfo/address: 340 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Amazing hotel with amazing views. The sound of the sea is really quite something. Rooms are cool and spacious and staff were very friendly. The games the staff put on for hotel guests for Sri Lankan new year were very wholesome and thoughtful.
title: Great hotel

placeInfo/address: 340 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel is very conveniently located—close to the town and right by the Galle Road. It’s a clean and pleasant place, and the staff are very friendly. The food is good, though there isn’t a wide variety. You get a good level of privacy overall.

The only drawback is that the swimming pool is right next to the restaurant, so guests dining there can see you while you’re in the pool, which compromises privacy a bit. There’s easy access to the beach as well, but again, not much privacy there either, which I personally didn’t like.

All in all, it’s a decent place for a short stay.
title: Decent place for a short stay.

placeInfo/address: 340 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Отель в который хочется вернуться! Отель расположен можно сказать прям в океане, что делает его особенным! Персонал очень дружелюбный, улыбчивый, все просьбы решались мгновенно. Уборка, смена полотенец, шампуни, мыло пополнялись каждый день. По питанию вообще шикарно, у нас были завтраки, обеды и ужины. На завтрак всегда был шведский стол, а вот обеды и ужины были целые церемонии, подача блюд как в ресторане, салат, суп, и главное блюдо на выбор, десерт. Из фруктов всегда были ананасы, папайя, арбузы, бананы. Шезлонги у бассейна всегда были, места хватало всем. Очень хороший бар в отеле. Отдельное спасибо хочется сказать персоналу отеля и конечно же управляющему и шеф повару!
title: Отель в который хочется вернуться!!!

placeInfo/address: 340 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Отдыхали в апреле 2025 года. Отпуск удался, отель хороший, чистый, ожидала хуже. Попросили номер с видом на море, без проблем дали. Расположение отеля очень удобное. с одной стороны пляж без волн 5 минут хотьбы с ребёнком. с другой черепаший примерно так же. Напротив можно купить сим-карту и обменять деньги, курс выгоднее чем в аэропорту. Ели в горизонте чисто и вкусно. Завтраки неплохие, фрукты, омлет, панкейки, можно найти что поесть. Брали только завтраки. В номерах убираются каждый день, меняют полотенца. Отпуск очень понравился. Персонал отзывчивый. Переживала как с ребёнком отдыхать в Шри-Ланке. всё здорово, даже с маленьким ребёнком
title: всё круто

бассейн, лежаки в доступе, полотенца для пляжа.

Отель Coral Rock Bu Bansei оставил самые яркие впечатления! С первых минут поразил теплый прием: персонал встречал с улыбками, быстро организовал заселение.  

Номер — просторный,  чистый.  Убирали ежедневно. Соседствоали муравьи, но не напрягали совсем.

Вид на океан и шум прибоя это нечто!

Питание— выше всяких похвал! Ресторан радовал разнообразием: от изысканных европейских блюд до местной кухни с морепродуктами. Завтраки с свежевыжатыми соками и ужины с авторскими десертами. Отдельное спасибо шеф-повару за гастрономические шедевры!  

Сервис— на уровне! Персонал всегда готов помочь по мере своих возможностей. 

Готов рекомендовать отель !
title: Незабываемый отдых.

placeInfo/address: 340 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Empfehlung für die Fortbewegung wäre die App "Pick me"
text:
Waren für 3 Nächte im Coral Rock. Die Lage ist zentral in Hikkaduwa zwischen Meer und Straße, leider ist der Strand nicht mehr vorhanden. Das Personal ist überaus freundlich und zuvorkommend. Das Frühstücksbuffet ist ausreichend.  In der Nähe sind sehr schöne Strände. Wie in fast allen Hotels sind überwiegend (95%)russische Gäste die die begrenzten Liegen reservieren,  wenn sie später auch nicht erscheinen. 
Ein Hinweisschild das nicht genutzte Liegen geräumt werden könnte Abhilfe schaffen; sofern auch umgesetzt wird.
title: Gutes Hotel ohne direkten Strand

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Greetings From Taj Samudra, Colombo!
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at Taj Samudra on Trip Advisor. We’re thrilled to hear that you enjoyed our services and facilities. Your kind words motivate our team to continue providing exceptional hospitality.
We look forward to welcoming you back for another memorable stay. If there’s anything we can do to enhance your next visit, please let us know.
Warmest Regards,
Samrat Datta
Area Director Taj Maldives & Sri Lanka
and General Manager of Taj Samudra
placeInfo/address: 25 Galle Face Center Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
Recently, I got an opportunity to stay at Taj Samudra along with my family and I must say; it was a perfect experience beyond the expectations. As soon as I entered, the staff was very warm, welcoming, and attentive such that I have felt special during my stay.

The location is perfect, right across the ocean with breathtaking views and conveniently close to key landmarks in Colombo.

The hospitality was excellent. As soon as we entered, we were greeted by the friendly staff with  smiles and typical Sri Lankan hospitality.
Special thanks and shout out to  to Ms. Thamali Wijesiri and Mr. Samrat Datta who ensured every detail of my stay was perfect and fabulous. We are grateful  to them for  going above and beyond to make our experience so memorable and unforgettable.

  My room was very large with all the amenities and was as clean as could be with a lovely Balcony overlooking the sea which made mornings even more special. The bed was very comfortable and the room service was quick and efficient.
The pool surroundings were calm and well kept and provided an oasis of tranquility in the city. I also liked the green gardens and the feeling of serenity that the premises gives although located in a busy area of Colombo.

I really liked the buffet breakfast and Dinner at POC, a huge variety of local and international dishes.One of the greatest highlight of our stay was the fact that there was Indian vegetarian food available. As vegetarians, we felt quite pleased to get the original and tasty Indian food . A big  thanks to Chef Nair and Chef Anuj. I cannot fail to mention names of Ruwan and Dasum who served not only efficiently but also with a smile which was very impressive.

One can hardly find this kind of commitment and elegance in service, and the staff of Taj actually embodies the gist of Indian and Sri Lankan hospitality.

On the whole, Taj Samudra combines classic style and the service of the international level. I would definitely recommend  it to other business as well as leisure travelers.
title: A Holiday we will always remember

roomTip: Avoid 7th floor if wedding above
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Taj staying in an ocean view club room and suite. The club lounge is the best and made our stay. The staff are so friendly helpful and  attentive . Amar,Nisal, Sanjeewa and Michael were all wonderful and we so looked forward to coming back home to the club lounge to our tea coffee and hot chocolate. Great to print stuff and use the boardrooms for meetings. The housekeeping staff were great too rooms  kept very clean, and a special shout out to Dhanushka. The reception staff were also so helpful and a special thankyou to Anjalee and Mr Dhuruv. If we had any issues and we only had one on the first night staff were very quick to sort it. The issue was if staying on the 7th floor there was a lot of noise from the music from weddings  above but as soon as we were moved to the 6th floor we had no issues. Feel better soundproofing is required unless a wedding guest. Overall a wonderful experience fantastic staff and made to feel at home. Highly reccomend the Taj club rooms in particular. Will surely be back
title: Wonderful stay

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Als je een safari wilt gaan doen pak de middag trip.
text: Het is een gelegen in een mooie omgeving. De kamer was ruim, mooi en schoon. Het zwembad was een ware oase van rust. Het personeel is ontzettend vriendelijk. Een service met een lach van oor tot oor. Het ontbijt wordt op een boven etage geserveerd met een magnifiek uitzicht. Het avondeten wordt onder geserveerd. Alles wat we gegeten hebben was erg lekker.
title: Een oase van rust

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Only a few rooms so you’ll need to book ahead.
text: This is such a great hotel. Right in the jungle - fabulous pool to cool off in and the happiest, friendliest locals who were just a joy to be around.  We stayed one night and the cabins were perfect.   It’s right beside the elephant safari so a perfect stop over hotel. Chanuka really took the time to welcome us and Shamika’s cooking was brilliant. The Sri Lankan curry delicious and the best Sri Lankan omelette I’ve had so far.  Shout out to groundskeeper Anula for keeping the place so beautiful.  We highly recommend this clean friendly hotel.
title: Perfect little hotel with everything you need.

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: Our stay at Jungle Paradise was excellent from start to finish. I travelled here with my husband, friend and her little boy. I speak both English and Sinhala, so it was very nice to chat away in both to them. My husband who doesn't speak Sinhalese felt very welcome here and they didn't just use me as a translator as they did in some places but spoke in English with him. The food was excellent with generous portions. The Sri Lankan food was devoid of pretention and tasted like good, home cooked food. The pool was excellent, shallow but deep enough to enjoy a nice swim. My friend's little boy is a little unruly at times and they spoke to him really kindly and treated him well, even playing Caram with him one time. They had 3 little cats who were very cute and friendly. The rooms were beautiful - we had the upper apartment and my husband and I had the bigger room with the four-poster bed which was beautiful and very comfortable. They arranged a jeep safari at Udawalawe which was also excellent! The driver was experienced and brilliant. All the staff were super friendly and welcoming from the start, we will certainly be back and highly recommend this hotel! I also went for a lovely little run (2 miles) near the hotel. It's beautiful and secluded.
title: Excellent friendly hotel

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: The Jungle Paradise was the perfect hotel we were looking for from our visit to the Udawalawe National Park.  It’s quiet, relaxing, very clean, reasonably priced, has great food, and a nice pool with a sunny area to tan and a shaded area to chill in if the sun is too strong.  Chanuka was pretty much running the whole place and did an amazing job.  He was our bellman, our concierge, our waiter, our barista, and even pointed out a few cool birds/animals to us that we would have otherwise missed out on.  There was no task he couldn’t help out with!  Everything we ordered from the restaurant was great as well.  The Chicken Kuttu was my favorite and I had it every day.  The restaurant has an upstairs balcony which was great for bird watching.
title: Perfect place to stay while visiting the Udewalawe National Park

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Accueillis sous la pluie mais par 2 immenses sourires!

Merci pour votre accueil si chaleureux, notamment Chanuka, de grands sourires à chaque fois, tout en étant efficace et avec beaucoup d'humour, nous avons adoré!

Il faut être honnête, la chambre était assez spartiate, avec une grande terrasse, une grande salle de bain assez sommaire, mais tout l'essentiel y est.

Le personnel est à l'écoute de vos demandes et fait de son mieux pour y répondre.
L'hôtel est idéalement situé à proximité du parc national pour le safari.
title: Une bulle de gentillesse et de douceur

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: Hotel Jungle Paradise is a beautiful hotel set in a stunning environment. Our room was in a separate cottage, where we had a large bathroom, beds with mosquito nets, and a terrace with seating. The hotel offers an outdoor pool and a restaurant that serves espresso. Its location in nature provides perfect tranquility for rest and relaxation. An added advantage is its proximity to Udawalawa National Park.
title: Tranquil retreat at Jungle Paradise

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Just go !!
text:
Amazing hotel with excellent facilities.  4 of us stayed in the top apartment with balcony views across the forest.  Was able to see eagles and cranes from our room.

The pool was excellent, very very clean.  The restaurant was good value and great food.  The evening Sri Lankan Curry was the best we had had on the trip.

The hotel organised the best elephant safari for less than the local.specialist and had the best guide / driver.  We saw lots of wildlife including mongoose, water buffalo, eagles, peacocks, Sri Lankan golden foul as well as many many elephants, deer and more.

Would absolutely stay again.  Was definitely a highlight of our trip.
title: Wow what a place - excellent

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: We had a fantastic welcome at Jungle Paradise and the staff were brilliant throughout our stay.  It was amazing watching the monkeys swinging through the trees as we ate our breakfast outside.  Our accommodation was great, with two bedrooms, bathroom and a small kitchen area.
title: Lovely place to stay

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Parking is not a problem. When getting there, look out for the feather sign
text:
We loved our time at the Jungle Paradise. The room was very spacious and clean with a very big terrace. 
The swimming pool was clean and it was a nice to be able to spend some time relaxing after the safari etc.
The staff seemed genuinely nice, friendly and always ready to help if needed. Chanukah at the reception was especially nice - during our first dinner he called us to come hear & then  see an owl that happened to be at the property. Small thing but it showed passion for nature and going extra mile for us guests.
The restaurant of the hotel is nice - they ask you to order in advance as the chef cooks everything right there & needs to calculate the time needed.
I also recommend going for safari and visiting other sites of Udawalawe with the hotel driver Lassa who was great!
Definitely recommend this hotel and would happily return there myself!
title: Great place, very happy with our choice

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: Exceptionnel tout simplement, personnel parfait, environnement naturel extraordinaire, piscine magnifique, nourriture excellente, que des compliments, chambre plus que spacieuse avec une grande terrasse donnant directement sur la végétation.
title: Hôtel formidable

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: Out of all the overnight stays we did in Sri Lanka this was one of our favourites and and it was also the cheapest. The grounds are immaculate, the pool is well maintained, the rooms are large, clean and functional with jungle views. It is 10 minutes from Udawalawe National Park! Best of all, the food was outstanding! Our whole stay for one night with breakfast & dinner was £62! I highly recommend
title: Brilliant stay

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
We stopped over for a 2 nights stay to visit near Udawadala National park. The Small resort is very clean, nice and quite new built.

The staff is nice, pool area invites for an afternoon relax. The villas are nice too.

Most unexpected they have a la cimbali espresso machine they even use for everyday tasty coffee! Way the best in the resorts/hotels we experienced so far in Sti Lanka 👏👏👏.
title: Nice, friendly & Barista Coffee!

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: If you want to relax or have an overnight stay before your safari, this is the place to be. There is nothing nearby, only nature, so be prepared to simply relax. The staff is indescribably friendly, sweet, and helpful. It is daily run by a small group of young men. It’s a pleasure to see how they help each other and how happy they are. The food is also good, and they manage it perfectly with the chef. I would recommend this place any time.
title: Relaxation

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Kleines Paradies mitten im Dschungel. 
Die Zimmer sind sehr groß mit einem ebenfalls rießigem Badezimmer. Vom Balkon blickt man direkt ins Grüne. Auch der Pool ist sehr schön. 
Sehr gute Lage zum Nationalpark, obwohl es etwas abseits gelegen ist. Leider waren wir nur für eine Nacht dort, weshalb wir die Anlage an sich nicht so nutzen konnten wie wir es gerne getan hätten. Kontinentales Frühstück sehr gut mit sehr gutem Kaffee.
title: Naturparadies mittem im Dschungel

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Magnifique endroit en pleine nature. Bungalow très propre et spacieux. Accueil formidable. 
L'hôtel nous a organisé un safari avec leur chauffeur Lasa qui a une connaissance incroyable de la faune et la flore, ce qui a rendu notre safari unique. Je recommande!
title: Belle découverte en pleine nature

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Een bezoek in de vroege ochtend (6u) aan het Udalalawe Safari Park is een aanrader.
text: De naam zegt het, een waar paradijs. Een ruime tuin met een prachtig zwembad. Zeer rustig gelegen. De grote kamers zijn voorzien van alle comfort. Terras met uitzicht op de jungle. Een mega badkamer. Heel behulpzaam en vriendelijk personeel. Wij hebben er ook nog lekker gegeten.
title: Een waar paradijs.

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Mysiga små villor som man bor i med stora terasser som passar bra för fågelskådning. Vi såg papegojor från vårt rum och även vid frukosten en gång. Även bra AC (dock ingen ac på badrummet..). 
Trevlig pool att njuta av efter safari! 
Serviceinriktad personal och trevlig hund som hette Charlie som bodde där med.
title: Djungelvistelse i Udawalawe

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: Loved our stay here from 1st contact to departure, they arranged our collection from Ella & drop off to Mirissa and also our safari & everything went like clockwork Chanuka & Shamika ran the place between them and were so nice & friendly food was great & service could not have been better. Totally secluded the sights & sounds of the jungle were amazing
title: Amazing Jungle stay

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
We LOVED our stay at Jungle Paradise. We stayed two nights and it was pure bliss - the balconies looking onto the jungle are so peaceful and you are surrounded by birdsong. The staff are so incredibly helpful and friendly - organising our safari, taxis, and excursions (the elephant transit orphanage was a highlight!). The pool area is perfect to relax after the safari and the food is delicious - important as it’s easier to eat lunch / dinner at the hotel in this area. 
The room was huge with a particularly large bathroom! Mosquito nets and air con all provided!
title: Peaceful, stress free stay

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed for one night but we wish we stay longer as it was amazing, felt like we were in the middle of the jungle but it was also so close to the national park. Rooms were great, the pool was perfect for relaxing afternoon but the main highlights goes to all the staff work there, they were amazing. Big thank you to Gernot who was so helpful before and during our stay.
title: Paradise in the jungle

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff was so attentive and kind. The food was delicious and the pool was delightful. The room was large and comfortable. It was very conveniently located near many attractions. Would stay here again and highly recommend it.
title: Delightful hotel

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
What a wonderful hotel this is. The setting is absolutely beautiful, by a lake, with the most beautiful, clam sunset in the middle of nature. We had a family room (for 4 people) on two levels, children upstairs, parents downstairs with amazing views to the pool. The food was amazing, with great prices and very professional service, beautiful tables facing the gardens.
Perfect place to enjoy a swin in the warm pool, followed by great food and rest after a days full of activities around the area. Great value for money
title: Beautiful place, amazing setting

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr/s, Clare,
Thank you so much for such a wonderful review! We are absolutely thrilled to hear  that you enjoyed your stay with us and that we became one of your favorite hotels in Sri Lanka - that really means everything to us!
Our kind words about our team mean a lot to us and I will definitely convey our kind sentiments to them all. Our chefs will be particularly happy to hear you enjoyed the food as they do work hard to balance traditional Sri Lankan dishes with Western favorites. 
We would love to welcome you back again on your next visit to Sri Lanka and thank you for the wonderful review.
Regards,
Ranjith K
Manager
placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: The accommodation was beautiful right next to a lovely lake. It had huge rooms that you could sit on the balcony and watch so much wildlife and birds in the gardens. The swimming pool and food was lovely. All the staff were very friendly and Samiri looked after us very well indeed.
title: Beautiful location, delicious food and lovely staff.

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Nous y avons séjourné une nuit après une journée d’excursion.très bon accueil du propriétaire des lieux avec une boisson rafraîchissante. Très bon repas du soir et un petit déjeuner très copieux.
Très belle chambre spacieuse et propre 
Belle piscine.
title: Parfait

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent 4 nights at Athena Lake during our stay in Sri Lanka. The hotel offers accommodation in the main building or by the pool. The rooms are spacious, featuring comfortable beds with mosquito nets. The bathroom is well-equipped, with a skylight high above the shower providing natural light.

The hotel boasts an outdoor pool with sun loungers and has its own garden where they grow fresh produce. They offer a three-course evening menu with generous portions, catering to all tastes. Even for those with lactose intolerance, they strive to find suitable alternatives.

The breakfast menu includes a variety of fruits, toast, eggs, pancakes, fresh juice, and tea/coffee. The staff is amazing, making it a place you’ll want to return to.
title: Place where you want to return

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: A really beautiful hotel , friendly staff , gorgeous pool and delicious food. Lovely gardens and lake views. I would recommend this place. A quiet location . Very clean and a lovely bathroom. Bed is a four poster with mosquito net. Good value
title: A lovely stay

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: We were upgraded to a suite that was a great size and had a large balcony. We had AC and a mosquito net along with fridge, safe, cable TV ETC. They did a really good value fixed menu and a la carte for dinner as well as a fabulous breakfast. Service was excellent.
title: Great Value and Very Nice Food

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Madam,
We appreciate your feedback and are delighted to know you enjoyed our Food & service. Your satisfaction is our top priority, and we look forward to serving you again soon. Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. 
Kind Regards,
Ranjith Kumara
Manager
placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: They don’t seem to have twin bed rooms.  Need to use a rollaway.
text:
Tucked away by the lake is this little oasis. Staff are friendly and the food is good. 
We were given the penthouse apartment which was spacious. 

There is a pathway that leads down to a floating dock which is a quiet place to sit and reflect. 

They also grow some of their own produce. The pool is lovely but very cold. They also do laundry service here.

I overall very clean and comfortable and staff are very accommodating and friendly
title: Riverside oasis

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Alloggio strepitoso in mezzo al verde di Dumbulla.
Struttura nuova con camere spaziose e ben tenute, giardino curato con piscina, colazioni e cene servite con la massima attenzione al dettaglio e molto ricche nella proposta agli ospiti.
Consiglio vivamente.
title: Ottimo soggiorno a Dumbulla

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
As always, a lovely stay at beautiful Athena Lake. This was our second stay, we where here same period last year, and this stay was just as marvellous as last year. Friendly staff an really great food. Last evening they even set the table by pool for us. We will for sure visit Athena Lake next time we go to Sri Lanka. This is one of my favourite places in the world.
The rooms are clean, hot woter, comfortable beds, beautiful surroundings, but best av all is the friendly staff. Nevatha hamuwemu and Bohoma sthuthi for a wonderful stay.
title: Paradise on earth

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Our second time at Lovely Athena Lake, and it was just as wonderful as our first time.
Stayed here for two  nights, 28 to 30th of December, on our tour around Sri Lanka. We can easily say that Athen Lake is a beautiful place with friendly staff and marvellous food. This is a great place for relaxing.
title: Lovely Athena Lake

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr Lynn logue,
We appreciate your feedback and are delighted to know you enjoyed our Food & service. Your satisfaction is our top priority, and we look forward to serving you again soon. Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. 
Kind Regards,
Ranjith Kumara
Manager
placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
We can’t handle very spicy food and my wife has some food allergies. The staff accommodated this really well.
We celebrated our 49th wedding anniversary during our stay. The staff surprised us by decorating our room with flowers, an anniversary message written with leaves, a heart shape using our sheet and swan shapes with towels. In addition they treated us to a candlelit dinner by the pool, followed by a celebration cake.
During our meals they provided tastings of Sri Lankan foods and encouraged us to try them.
A lovely stay overall.
title: Great staff, spacious room and peaceful setting.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir/Madam,
We appreciate your feedback and are delighted to know you enjoyed our Food & service. Your satisfaction is our top priority, and we look forward to serving you again soon. Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. 
Kind Regards,
Ranjith Kumara
Manager
placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed a night with a family of 9 pax. We were welcomed with a lovely welcome drink. The rooms were quite spacious. The dining staff were very attentive and able to cater our requests with a smile which is very important for me. Dinner was lovely, and had a good spread of Sri Lankan meals. Breakfast was good. The only setback was AC - no chill. All rooms were the same and the water heater was not hot. Overall, a lovely place to stay in Dambhulla.
title: A hidden gem near lake!

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: Our stay was as beautiful as it seems in the pictures. The family room was just perfect, offering all the comfort and space we needed. The food couldn't have been better – every meal was delicious and well-prepared. Additionally, the employees were incredibly helpful and made our stay even more enjoyable. Highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a perfect getaway!
title: Fantastic Stay – Even Better Than the Pictures!

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: Superbe établissement situé en pleine nature avec une magnifique piscine très bien entretenue. Chambre spacieuse et très propre. Personnel adorable et très attentionné ! Très bon dîner dans le jardin avec une très belle ambiance. Très proche du Lion’s Rock !
title: Superbe !

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: Très bel établissement, chambres spacieuses et confortables, très belle piscine bien entretenue, personnel attentif et sympathique. Excellent restaurant, possibilité de dîner aux chandelles dans le jardin. Très bons petits-déjeuners, calme absolu. Revers de la médaille, très loin de tout et difficile à trouver. Si l'on est pas véhiculé, une fois dans l'hotel... on y reste !
title: bel hôtel, mais très excentré

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Seul bémol, l’accès. Prévoir un gps.
text:
Hôtel en pleine nature et très agréable ( pas un bruit)
Nous y sommes resté 2 nuit.
Nous avions notre chambre séparée du bâtiment principal sur le côté de la piscine.
Chambre très spacieuse, propre et climatisée.
Nous avons dîner et petit déjeuner 2 fois et s’était vraiment excellent et fin, leur chef est très bon.
Possibilité de dîner à l’extérieur avec bougies pour une soirée romantique.
Une équipe a l’écoute et très agréable.
Nous vous recommande vivement cet hôtel
title: Très bonne destination

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir/Madam,
Thank you for taking the time share your feedback on Trip Advisor, it gives us great pleasure to know that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us especially about Food, service and nature. We have shared your compliments to the Team and they are equally happy to know that their efforts are so well appreciated.  
Thank you once again for your compliments and we all look forward to having you back with us soon again at Athena Lake..
placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Très bel hôtel.
Chambres spacieuses, beau jardin et agréable piscine. M
Les repas y sont excellents.
Le personnel est agréable, serviable et souriant.
L’emplacement est parfait pour visiter le triangle culturel.
Nous y avons séjourné 3 jours et nous sommes enchantés.
title: Superbe

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: Pernottato tre notti ai primi di Febbraio 2024’ durante viaggio in Sri Lanka. Eravamo in 3, ci hanno assegnato una camera comoda (la prima al piano superiore, credo la numero 1), in realtà si trattava di due camere, una nella mansarda,  aria condizionata separata. Buona sistemazione, consigliabile se si e’ in famiglia. Struttura carina, bel giardino, bella piscina, abbiamo pernottato tre notti e cenato una sera. Buona la colazione, buona la cena, anche se, a mio giudizio, è meglio cenare nei vari ristoranti in giro.  se pernottate più di una notte, meglio uscire a cena. Quanto ai dintorni, puo’ essere ottima base per tour a sigiriya,  polonnaruwa, ovviamente dambulla .consigliabile.
title: Sosta di tre notti a sigiriya

ownerResponse/text:

We have shared your compliments to the Team and they are equally happy to know that their efforts are so well appreciated.

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Athena Lake was the perfect stay during our time visiting the Sigiriya area. The staff was very attentive, making sure we had everything we needed. Breakfast and dinner are in a beautiful setting, we felt very relaxed and absolutely loved the food! We actually think their Sri Lankan curry was the best we had! A lot of their produce is also grown in their own garden.
Definitely a place to remember, thank you Athena Lake!
title: Beautiful area & boutique hotel

roomTip: Tamarind Tree Garden Resort exceeded all our expectations. This resort offers the perfect balance of luxury and nature, with lush gardens su
text:
Tamarind Tree Garden Resort exceeded all our expectations. This resort offers the perfect balance of luxury and nature, with lush gardens surrounding the entire property. The moment we arrived, we were greeted by friendly staff, who made sure all our needs were met throughout our stay. The rooms were spacious, clean, and beautifully decorated, providing a cozy and relaxing environment.

The resort’s amenities, like the swimming pool and restaurant, were exceptional. The food was fresh and flavorful, offering both local and international cuisine. We loved spending our days lounging by the pool and exploring the resort’s natural beauty.

If you're looking for a peaceful getaway that combines relaxation, nature, and excellent service, Tamarind Tree Garden Resort is definitely the place to be. We can’t wait to return
title: Wonderful Hospitality

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bring mosquito repellent
text:
This hotel is ideally placed, being only 15 minutes from Colombo airport and we stayed here before and after our tour, yet it was much more than a simple jumping off point. The rooms are extremely spacious and spread throughout the meticulously kept gardens in small ground floor blocks. Staff are really attentive and friendly and the food was excellent.
We had a large room with separate living area on the first night and a more conventional room for the second visit. Both were a little dated but air-conditioned and comfortable. However if you want to take advantage of the large outdoor verandahs or pool area be sure to bring mosquito repellent!
title: Spacious, quiet, comfortable and friendly.

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text:
Ask for soft pillows as the ones we has originally were very hard. All the staff were attentive & polite. We'd particularly like to mention Darsha, who even arranged a surprise farewell/anniversary lunch for us, Nishani who was always ready to help, Ayuka, a trainee Manager who even went to a local phone shop to buy me a replacement charger, in his own time! Sriani, our main Housekeeper, who kept our villa spotless & us topped up with water daily! The waiting staff, particularly Sharnada, who was attentive without being intrusive, were always polite & smiling. The kitchen staff, who we hardly ever saw, did an amazing job of providing fresh, delicious, if a trifle too spicy for my palate, food every day and some of the most delicious bread for our morning toast and marmalade! 
The villas are in need of some maintainance where the tropical weather & termites have been at work, but final mention to the Gardeners who keep the extensive gardens in perfect balance for visual beauty but nature friendliness...birds galore, lizards, even some (non-venomous) snakes & daily visits from the mongooses!  A Nature lovers paradise....not just for the night before/after your flight. We had a week here, and it wasn't enough.
title: Perfect place to relax in nature

ownerResponse/text:

roomTip:
It may be worth considering an arrival or departure stay after or before a long flight.
The swimming pool was large and not crowded.
text:
We went with a group of friends for a short break. We were overwhelmed by the welcoming hospitality on arrival.
The air of tranquility was immediately apparent as we entered the tree lined drive of this 17 acre garden resort. 
This Resort is particularly convenient with its close proximity to Bandaranaike International Airport, especially after arriving from a long flight such as UK. Despite the closeness of the airport one is hardly aware of any air traffic. 
Your recovery continues with relaxing and rejuvenating reasonably priced Ayurvedic Massages performed by charming competent therapists. There is also the option of a consultation with an experienced Ayurvedic Doctor. We were very impressed by his ability to diagnose ones general medical wellbeing by simply looking at you and taking pulse and blood pressure.There is also the availability of specific dietary and exercise plans tailored to the individual for those on longer stays.
The cuisine was very authentic and varied.
All members of staff very courteous and nothing being too much trouble.
The overall experience is highly recommended for those seeking peace and tranquility in Sri Lanka.
title: Ideal calming oasis for a newly arrived traveler.

text:
Was a great experience in Jetwing Beach hotel and had an incredible experience from start to finish. The rooms were clean, spacious, and had everything we needed for a comfortable and relaxing stay.

What really made our stay extra special was the exceptional service at the front desk. A big shoutout to Dahan and Sanoj  they were incredibly helpful, friendly, and always had a warm smile to welcome us. 

Thanks to their kindness and professionalism, our stay felt even more seamless and enjoyable. If you're looking for a relaxing hotel service, I highly recommend this hotel.

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
It’s a fairly big hotel. Good spacious clean room with doors leading out to terrace facing swimming pool and beach. Big bathroom. Huge bath. Really good shower. 
3 restaurants so plenty of choice. Buffet style breakfast with good variety of foods. 
Beautiful beach,  and sunbed area with lots of palms for shade. 
Downside - there was building materials and rubble lying against the wall outside our room by the terrace. Not pretty to look at and if we’d been staying longer than one night we would have asked for another room. Shouldn’t  have that in this level of accommodation.
title: Good hotel but not my favourite on our tour.

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 433 A Dadella, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: I booked the Gazebo at Jetwing Lighthouse for a special night with my significant other and the staff were really supportive. They updated me on the weather and helped me make a choice, asked me about any special requests I had and ensured everything went along perfectly. A special mention to Ms. Imasha who walked me through everything, made sure everything happened accordingly and to my liking, was there as long is I wanted her to be to help with the execution and above all was friendly and polite and accommodating, and to Chef Awantha who sat with me and curated a 5 course menu according to our preferences and delivered a superb meal. I would recommends this place, the view is beautiful and the sound of the waves crashing on the rocks while you are secluded in a private space is something very special.
title: Dinner at the Gazebo

placeInfo/address: 433 A Dadella, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 433 A Dadella, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We had the most wonderful stay at Jetwing Lighthouse, and our time in the Fa-Hsien Suite was truly unforgettable. The suite was incredibly spacious, spotlessly clean, and exceptionally comfortable, making it the perfect place to relax and unwind.

A special thank you to our personal butler, Umesha, who went above and beyond to ensure our stay was smooth and enjoyable. She was extremely kind, attentive, and always ready to help with a warm smile—her service really made our experience extra special.

The hotel itself is absolutely breathtaking, with its stunning architecture and scenic surroundings creating a serene and luxurious atmosphere. We also thoroughly enjoyed the delicious food—every meal was a treat!

We would highly recommend Jetwing Lighthouse to anyone looking for a peaceful and luxurious getaway. Can’t wait to return!
title: Jetwing Lighthouse

title: Truly Paradise

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed at Jungle Paradise as it was close to do a safari in the National Park. It was a lovely surprise to have rooms which felt like it was right in the jungle.  Comfortable rooms with good A/C. But the best part about it was the staff who are super attentive, funny and very friendly. We had a great safari and a visit to the Elephant Transit Home where they look after orphaned elephants until they are ready to back into the jungle.  It was a very emotional experience. I would highly recommend Jungle Paradise. Huge thanks to Charminda and Charminta. Hope I got the names right.
title: Great hotel with wonderful staff

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: Fairly basic rooms but the beds were comfortable and had mosquito nets. Lovely setting in the jungle with lots of birds, peacocks, monitors etc. to keep us entertained. Charminda and Charninda (spelling?) were the two lovely guys running the place - and nothing was too much trouble. The food was good but you need to order well in advance as it takes time to cook. The safari organized through the hotel was excellent and the driver was very knowledgeable and even had a book of birds and animals to show us the names.  They also arranged a tuk tuk outing to the Elephant Transit Home, which is well worth a visit - an ethical and well run care facility for orphaned elephants - and a nearby Buddhist temple. All in all, a very enjoyable stay.
title: Charming and helpful staff, lovely setting

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
A wonderful place to be, nice big room, comfortable big bed, an amazing bath room, and a beautiful balcony, also a nice pool, cute restaurant, with nice meals and cold beer.
And this place is very close to Udawalawa National Park, also to the Udawalaw Dam.
title: Paradise in the Jungle

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The property is tucked back a few hundred meters off the main road on a small dirt/gravel road.
text: We had a wonderful stay at Jungle Paradise.  The bungalow was clean and beautiful.  It had all amenities we required—hot water, good Wi-Fi and a fridge, as well as a comfortable bed.  Wonderful hospitality, great food (including espresso which is hard to find in Sri Lanka!) and a beautiful pool.  The staff was truly amazing—kind and responsive.  You will not be disappointed here.
title: Stay here

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Make sure you have cash for safari’s etc
text:
Super friendly and helpful staff.
Amazing pool which was well used after our safari tour that they organised for us. The driver was excellent and the park guide had amazing knowledge of all the animals and plants.
The room was great as well a really huge family room.
title: Family stay at Jungle Paradise

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: Very big rooms and comfortable beds. Beautiful balcony with views in the jungle. Nice swimming pool and the food was good. But the most important the service was amazing! They did everything for us and everybody were super nice
title: Amazing hotel!

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Definitely book the safari early in the morning and go through the resort....toll safari guide with lots of experience....
text:
Everything was very well organised (correspondence even in German) and the transport also worked out.
The complex is very clean and well maintained. The staff is very friendly and very helpful. We had a lot of laughs with the staff.

We rented the deluxe flat with two bedrooms. The whole furnishing (beautiful wooden furniture, comfortable sofas) is very typical for the country and we liked it very much. The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom clean (a bit less water pressure in the shower, but we know that from India and Sri Lanka, we took it with humour).

We had dinner at the resort: a typical curry, which was very tasty.
The breakfast was rich: a plate with fresh fruit, a papaya juice, pankecake with sweet coconut mixture and an omelette.

We also organised the safari through Jungel Paradise. We left at 6am and saw all kinds of animals: Elephants, crocodiles, eagles, jackals, chameleon, iguana â€¦for our son an insane experience.

We found it very nice that Jungle Paradise is located in the middle of wild nature. We heard many animals and everything was very green.

We thank the whole Jungle Paradise team for this great stay and the unforgettable experiences.
title: Safari feeling in the middle of wild nature, very well maintained and clean

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: Jungle Paradise was perfect. The people are so nice and really want to make you feel the best way. On the night, we played local game with them and the food was very good. The apartment deluxe is so nice for a family, the terrace is amazing and the location of the hotel is very close to the safari. I really recommend this hotel!
title: Amazing moment

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed in a family room and had a great time! Big, clean room with AC and mosquito nets without holes. Big bathroom with hot shower. The small pool is clean and not milky as we have seen it couple of times during our holiday. The staff is amazingly friendly and the cook's Moju is amazing!
title: Great family room

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: Its our second visit of this place. It is really a paradise. The rooms are very clean and big, nice bed, good aircon. After a safari the pool is fantastic to cool down. All together its really a great place. But the most amazing is the stuff. Their service if fantastic, they are so friendly, always with a smile. We had the lake fish for dinner, it was amazing. Cooked to perfection. So we loved our stay at this paradise. Thank you very much and hope to see you again.
title: It is a paradise.

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
We were greeted by friendly staff, who took care of our luggage and moved then into our room. The bed was huge! Lovelybalcony with tea and coffee services. 
We went for dinner and was able to have anything we would like cooked for us. We ordered traditional Sri Lankan dishes which were to die for! Our waiter was very polite and topped our dishes up whenever we required more. They even played added the extra touch of playing Irish and kiwi music.
The pool was beautiful to swim in the evening as the day cooled. 
This hotel is a must do before you venture off to your safari tour. Don’t forget the beautiful fresh breakfast after included in your stay ;)
title: Outstanding service

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel personnel was kind and attentive as much as it’s possible! Provided us with great service and apartments, which is really rare during off-season. Swimming pool was clean, dinner and breakfast were just perfect, safari to national park we booked at the hotel - great.
Thanks a lot to people who work here, you’re the best👍
title: Stay for one night for safari

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
A great experience at the Jungle paradise hotel. We stayed there with our family & friends and we really enjoyed the place. The rooms are big, super comfortable and clean,  and the staff is AMAZING !
We will definitely go back and we re recommending the place !
title: Amazing place with an amazing Staff !

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: This place exceeded all our expectations and we had a wonderful stay. The staff we unbelievably kind and so welcoming, we enjoyed catching up with them at the end of every day and felt like family. The food onsite was delicious and they helped us arrange an amazing safari. The rooms were clean comfortable and spacious and the pool was a great place to relax at the end of the day. A true paradise!
title: A little piece of paradise

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: This rooms at this resort are large with high ceilings, huge bathrooms and an amazing private balcony directly looking into lush jungle/forest. Such comfort, character and charm all in one.  We had a superb Sri Lanka vegetarian dinner cooked by their chef which was like having  Sri Lanikan home cooked food served to suit your taste. Truly one of the best meals we had during our stay. The property is beautifully maintained with friendly accommodating staff. Serene, peaceful and such a pleasure to return to after a rugged safari outing.  Our guide for the Udawalawe National Park safari was Dushantha as arranged by Bhathiya Tours. This delightful young man, with his deep knowledge of the park, ALL the wildlife and his ability to spot them from afar amazed us.  This resort is a real 'keeper' for future visits. So is Dushanta as our guide. We cannot speak highly enough of our stay at Jungle Paradise Hotel and safari at Udawalawe National Park. Jennifer & Ford / Bangkok, Thailand
title: A MUST Stay ...A MUST do!!

ownerResponse/text:
Hi Deirdre, 
thanks for your review, and sorry for the bad experience with the food. We had two days without a cook, so the kitchen was not in full operation. Now we are back with full staff. Happy that you still enjoyed the rooms and the pool.
Best regards
placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Had a 2 night family stay in Jungle Paradise. The room was very nice with a lovely balcony.  The grounds were lovely with a real sense of being in the countryside.  The pool was very relaxing. The staff were friendly and helpful.
The only issue we encountered here was the food. We tried various dishes over the 2 days, and it was not good and overpriced for the standard.
title: Jungle paradise Udawalawa

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: As soon as we arrived we were greeted warmly. Our room and all areas of the property are spotlessly clean. Our bathroom was huge! The pool was lovely and pool towels were provided. Sudesh organised a safari for us in the National Park which is just 10 minutes away. Our guide, Dulshan, was brilliant, pointing out animals and birds which we may have otherwise missed. We saw elephants, jackals, crocodiles, different types of monkey, & a mongoose as well as various unusual birds.
title: Lovely stay

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
We hade a perfect stay in Jungel Paradise hotel in Udawalawa. Nice and clean big rooms, pool, good food and fantasic staff, especially Namal ❤️
We can really recommend this hotel.  We will definitely be back next time we visit Sri Lanka.
Best regards from us 😃
title: Nice hotelstay in Udawalawa

text:
We stayed at the Tamarind Tree Garden Resort as a group of 20-30 people for two nights while attending an official conference. Our experience was excellent from start to finish.

The resort provided a perfect setting for our three-day conference, held in their spacious ballroom. The facilities were well-equipped, with tea and coffee available during the sessions, which was a thoughtful touch. The big garden and the serene environment added to the overall calmness, allowing us to focus during our sessions.

The rooms were comfortable and clean, with fresh linens and all necessary amenities, ensuring a pleasant stay for everyone. The meals were delicious, and the variety of options offered kept everyone satisfied.

A special thanks to Mr. Tennakoon, the F&B Executive, whose exceptional support and coordination made our conference seamless. The staff, in general, were incredibly friendly, helpful, and accommodating, which added to our positive experience.

Overall, the resort’s calm atmosphere, excellent facilities, and attentive staff made it an ideal venue for our conference. Highly recommended for group events or a peaceful getaway!
title: Day today getaway or business.. this is the place

A truly amazing three nights stay at Athena Lake Boutique. Lovely surroundings and even more lovely staff at the hotel. You will experience Sri Lanka in the best way and being served delicious meals all through your stay. The personal will go that extra mile to make your stay as joyful as possible.
We stayed here for during three nights and also celebrated New Year and can only give our best recommendations. On New Year's day, they showed us their tradition to do milkrice, which means that they boil rice and coconotmilk in a pot over open fire until it boild over. The second day, we went to Sigriya to climb and see the Lion Rock.
Many thanks to all the wonderful people at Athena Lake for making our stay so remarkable. I hope to see you all again.
title: Amazing and Wonderful

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We have stayed in room no. 403 for one night. The room is very spacious even after placing the extra bed and our big luggages. The washroom is huge with all modern amenities. The room has a verandah with a great view and a heating system. Lobby area is decorated in a very aesthetical manner, maintaining natural greenery. The breakfast area and items were also good. The only downside is the passage area. The noise comes in and goes out from the washroom ventilation. 
Enjoyed Spa treatment in their Lamaa Spa. Thanks to Michel for her excellent service, which has rejuvenated me for the next destination.
title: Heritage on the Hill top

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
From the moment we arrived, the staff made us feel incredibly welcome with their warm smiles and thoughtful service. The rooms were spacious, immaculately clean, and offered stunning views of the surrounding tea plantations and mountains.

Dining at The Blackpool was a highlight. The restaurant served a diverse menu of Sri Lankan and international cuisine, and every meal was flavorful and beautifully presented. Breakfasts were generous, with plenty of fresh fruit, hot dishes, and local treats.

What stood out most was the quiet luxury of the setting – the soft mist over the hills in the morning, the starry skies at night, and the overall feeling of peace and calm that’s hard to find elsewhere.
title: A Serene Escape at The Blackpool – Nuwara Eliya’s Princess of Little England

ownerResponse/text:
Many thanks for staying with us and for your kind words. We are thrilled to read that your Calamansi experience meant so much to you and in your comments, beautifully summarised the vibe and experience we are seeking to deliver to all our guests. Wheelchair users are welcome and we are equally pleased that we can help provide such joy. It was a great pleasure meeting you and we look forward to seeing you again in the not-too-distant future.

Best wishes
placeInfo/address: Wijerama Road Brahakmana Watte, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If required, let them know in advance of your stay that you require  a wheelchair accessible room. the staff are so accomodating
text:
After a few exhilarating days of early starts and dusty safari trails, it was time to slow the pace. My next stop was the serene and secluded Calamansi Cove Villas—a hidden gem along Sri Lanka’s southwestern coast, where relaxation is as much a part of the experience as the view itself.

Tucked away in lush tropical gardens and framed by crashing waves, Calamansi Cove felt like a sanctuary. The resort has an intimate, boutique feel, with just a handful of private villas thoughtfully spaced for privacy and tranquillity. The moment I arrived, I could feel my shoulders drop and my breath deepen. This was the Sri Lankan coastline at its most calming—no rush, no noise, just the sound of the ocean and the rustle of palm leaves overhead.

My accessible villa was conveniently located on the ground floor, with level access throughout. The open-plan design made it easy to navigate, and the staff had already anticipated my needs, offering small but thoughtful touches to make my stay more comfortable. Wide doorways, smooth paths, and a gentle slope into the villa made independent movement easy, and the privacy of my own little courtyard added an extra layer of peace.

The grounds themselves were a joy to explore. Meandering garden paths led through thickets of tropical flowers, overhanging vines, and the occasional splash of colour from native birds flitting between trees. I found quiet corners to sit and read, sip tea, or simply listen to the rhythm of the waves crashing onto the beach beyond the palms.

There was no itinerary here—just time. Time to breathe. Time to reflect. Time to let the vibrant pace of the trip so far settle into something slower and softer.

Calamansi Cove was a gentle reminder that travel, especially as a wheelchair user, doesn’t always have to be a high-adrenaline adventure. Sometimes, it’s about finding places where nature and comfort hold equal space—and giving yourself permission to rest within them.
title: A hidden Gem - Time to relax and unwind

ownerResponse/text:
Thankyou for being such loyal guests and for your ongoing support and it was a pleasure welcoming you back. We look forward to seeing you again in the not too distant future.
Best wishes.
placeInfo/address: Wijerama Road Brahakmana Watte, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
text:
We’ve stayed at Calamansi Cove Villas three times already, and every time we leave, we start dreaming about coming back again. It’s truly a place that feels like home — but on vacation.

The biggest highlight for us is the exceptional service. The people who work here are incredibly kind and warm. It’s such a joy to return and see familiar faces who not only remember us, but also know and genuinely care about our children. That kind of connection is rare and deeply meaningful.

We want to give special thanks to Sujith, Nerodha, Shalini and Jayavira, who have looked after us and our children every single time we’ve visited. Their care and attention make all the difference, and we are so grateful for their presence.

This is a perfect place for curious little explorers — our kids loved collecting coconuts, spotting iguanas and monkeys, watching hermit crabs, searching for shells, and exploring the plants and flowers. The surroundings are simply beautiful: peaceful, private, and just steps away from a quiet beach.

We’re already planning our next trip with the whole family, even if it means traveling for 24 hours with two kids — it’s always worth it for the rest, nature, and warmth we experience at Calamansi Cove.

Also, a special shoutout to Asela for the unforgettable massage — truly a highlight of the stay!

This place has a piece of our hearts. We’ve traveled a lot, but Calamansi Cove Villas is one of those rare gems we always want to return to.
title: A Paradise for Families and Little Explorers

ownerResponse/text:
Thankyou for your visit and we were thrilled to read about how happy your stay was including its magical moments. We look forward to welcoming you back in 2027.

Best wishes
placeInfo/address: Wijerama Road Brahakmana Watte, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If your looking for a busy night life this isnt the place to go.
text:
Having spent nearly two weeks here, I can confidently say it's the most breathtaking destination we've ever stayed at. Everything was flawless—the stunning location, picturesque villas, delicious food, and the incredible staff who quickly became dear friends. Nothing was ever too much trouble.

For those seeking peace and tranquility, this is the ultimate retreat. The lovely receptionist, Nirodha, expertly organized day trips, ranging from safaris and whale watching to countless other adventures. The photos simply don't do this place justice—it was truly majestic.

An unexpected highlight was a chance encounter on the beach with Priyantha, a local fisherman and TukTuk owner. This serendipitous meeting turned into the most enriching experience of our holiday. Priyantha became a cherished friend, staying with us all day and guiding us to unforgettable spots. He made my sister's birthday extra special by arranging a meal at his favorite restaurant, complete with flowers and a band to sing "Happy Birthday."

We were even honored to be invited to his home for a family meal, a genuinely heartwarming experience. We're already counting down the days until we return in 2027!
title: Paradise

The staff were first rate,nothing was too much trouble, a mention for, Nirodha,lovely lady who became a friend, Wacella,in the restaurant, the life guards, and Preantha, whom we met on the beach and became our tuk tuk  driver, even inviting us for a meal with his family, loved you all, hope to return in a couple of years, met the owner, please don't make too many changes, it is perfect.

placeInfo/address: Wijerama Road Brahakmana Watte, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
text: I stayed last year in early March for four nights, as I waited to get my India visa renewed.  I fell in love with the place, the food, the people who work there.  So this year I booked eight nights - and I could have easily been happy to stay another eight or eighteen even.  The staff, from Nirodha's expert concierge skills and kindness, to Sujit's attentive lifeguarding (and good company), to the housekeeping guys Sadeep, Harindu, Tharindu, to waiting staff including Harati, to the gardeners and handymen, to the gatekeeper who lets you know when your tuk tuk has arrived - it's a team that works together like a happy family.  And to top all of that, I had superb dinner company from one of the owners, Eveline - who generously gave me information about the local area and what it's like to live in Sri Lanka.  I stayed in the Calamansi Suite (above the restaurant) which is unbelievably spacious and serene.  The food here is worth a separate review of its own - once again I loved the grilled Jack fish dinner, the seafood mango/avo salad, the beet root, watermelon and feta salad, and perfectly fresh breakfast with just enough but not too much of what you want.  Love the chili-accented coconut ice cream.   I swam in the ocean every chance I could get - sometimes three times a day.  I really think Balapitiya has some of the very best swimming beaches in Sri Lanka (not that I have sampled them all - but can't imagine better).   I also fell for the small town and recommend walking along its main road to visit the shops - especially the Citizen Salon for a good haircut and truly great face and head massage!  I truly love this place and these people.  I can't think of a single other hotel in my travel experience that has me weeping when it's time to leave.
title: Happy Return

ownerResponse/text:
