ownerResponse/text:
Dear SAR28,

Thankyou for your stay with us and the feedback you have given. A bit of a delayed response but wanted to assure you that your comments have been taken on board. Finger bowls provided and no issue (sorry that there was - this is not normal!); ice cream given is full scoops and we certainly provide french fries - I can only apologize if they were not there on your visit. Again, normally this is a daily item. You are correct that the childrens menu is somewhat limited to the staples and so we encourage guests to just ask for what they would like and it can be prepared directly.
Thanks again for the constructive input. We are better for it...
Best wishes.
placeInfo/address: Wijerama Road Brahakmana Watte, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
text:
We liked the design of the property as all rooms have their own sit-out / lounge area outside (loads of mozzies but the staff do come and light mosquito coils, definitely have repellent on you too if you want to enjoy sitting outside), the wash rooms have access from the outside as well so the room doesn't get messy with sand after a day at the beach and there is a terrace although we didn't use it - perhaps good if you have a crowd and want a secluded place to chill.

We were on B&B basis - the breakfast spread was extensive. We lasted well past lunch after having a full breakfast! The ala carte menu doesn't cater to kids much so if you have very young kids you may was to prepare for this or speak to the chef in advance and get something organised. (for example, they don't have regular potato chips... only fried manioc which was ok for us but some kids may not like the flavour). The quality of the food is good, but they use fancy dishes which meant we only got approximately a tablespoon of ice cream! (for desserts that came with ice cream). One of the kids use their fingers to have rice for lunch and when we asked for a finger bowl they said it's against the hotel's policy .... erm - it's a finger bowl?! You also don't get dinner rolls if you've only ordered a main course and not a soup / starter (!!!) 

We had a triple room and the linen on the extra bed was torn - which isn't on for a hotel of this  calibre. We noticed this on the morning of our check-out so didn't bother to / forgot to tell the staff.

The place is really nice, but we just felt like there were a few too many inconveniences.
title: Lovely property, but ...

ownerResponse/text:
Thanks Chamaragms for your stay and comments. Looking forward to seeing you back again soon.
Best wishes

My wife and I spent 3 relaxing days  for a special Birthday, in this very nice small hotel, 2 hours drive from the heart of Colombo.

text:
We had spent our new year holidays at Calamansi! We will definitely come back there one day. Very private hotel with beautiful territory, location and beach. Waves are not so high, it is perfect for families with kids. Special thanks for rescue man who is working there - Sujith. Very nice person, who looked for us and our kids while swimming in the pool and on the beach. Restaurant there is perfect, Chef prepared us excellent meal a La carte every day, different options. Chandana and Dilar, are very professional staff in the restaurant, they make our meals special every time! Also, Nirodha our manager is very king and caring person, she helped us with all our request all holiday. Feeling from our holiday, was like we spent a holiday in Sri Lankan family, in beautiful villa complex. Monkeys, exotic birds, lizards on the territory, our kids were so happy. Also, I recommend to try Massage with Asel there and private Yoga classes were great! 
Thank you Calamansi team, hope to see you all one day again.

text: A gorgeous place to stay for a few days at the end of our two week trip to Sri Lanka.  Situated on a virtually private immaculately clean beach next to a fishing village it is very picturesque. With tranquil villa style rooms set in gardens with access to the lovely pool and the beach it was very relaxing.  The staff are extremely helpful and meticulous in all that they do.  We enjoyed the breakfasts with the delicious fruit (and curd that was ordered in specially for us) and had light lunches there too.  The evening meals were good but we were also able to walk along the beach to another beautiful hotel called Sundara to ring the changes for one night.  Highly recommend the massage by a talented local masseuse and the excellent yoga sessions by Saman.  Well equipped rooms with lovely bathrooms, air conditioning and good wifi.
title: Gorgeous beach side retreat

text:
A slice of heaven in Balapitiya 

Just spent a wonderful weekend here staying at Passion and Pomello which we’re ocean facing villas by the pool.

The rooms were very comfortable and spacious for a family of four. The bed was big enough for the four of us (2 small kids and 2 adults) There is a lovely sitting area outside and also the rooftop (but there was no seating available)

The food was delicious- highly recommend the rice and curry options. We also had the a la carte food which was very tasty.

The service was incredible! Our butler Thilak made sure all our needs were met and went out of his way to make sure we were ok. The life guard (whose name I didn’t catch ) was very good and stayed by us when we were both in the sea and the pool. Nirodha at the front office was also very helpful.

The pool is just perfect and the bay outside was superb to bob up and down in the sea. 

All in all it was a wonderful experience and we will definitely be back again!
title: A slice of heaven in Balapitiya

roomTip: The Rooms nearest the pool (named Starfruit and Pomelo I believe) open directly to the the pool and restaurant.
text: A group of us travelled to Calamansi Cove last week, and had an excellent two-night stay. We were ten adults and eight children ranging from 10 to 1. The place is very well designed for families with small children. The setting is a beautifully maintained garden with villa type rooms, each with its own private garden, outdoor space, and some rooftop space. The food overall was excellent, with something different offered for each meal. However what I would really like to commend were the hotel staff, who made our stay exceptional. Sujith, the hotel lifeguard, made our trip so much easier. He was always attentive without being intrusive, very gentle with the kids, and thoroughly trustworthy. Our trip experience would have been very different without him always on guard. The two serving staff we encountered, Chandana and Thilak, were so friendly, and extremely accommodating and obliging. Also our reservation and check-in were managed excellently by Nirodha, who also took every effort to ensure that we had a great stay. Special mention must be made of Tommy the hotel dog (fully vaccinated), who was also a great companion for the kids. One small problem with our trip was that the sea was not swimmable during our stay. Apparently June is not a great time for the sea here. But overall we had a great experience and would highly recommend Calamansi Cove for groups with small children.
title: Great for Groups with Small Children

ownerResponse/text:
This is a lovely review. Thank-you so much for sharing your views on Tripadvisor. As a nine-room hotel, we do feel we are small enough to try to offer a personalised service and, although we know we still have much to learn, we are thrilled that you felt we were "hosts" rather than just hotel staff. That means so much to us. Were glad also you loved the food and the quality of the rooms. Hope to see you again sometime and, if not, we wish you many happy holidays in the future!
Best regards
The Suite Lanka team
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
I highly recommend Suite Lanka if you’re planning a vacation on the southwest coast of Sri Lanka! This hotel is perfect for those seeking a peaceful, cozy, and romantic getaway.

The rooms are spacious, comfortable, and spotless, with daily cleaning service provided by the staff.

The food is exquisite. The à la carte breakfast is generous, and we also tried the lunch and dinner options—everything was absolutely delicious.

And last but not least—the staff. I would call them hosts rather than just hotel staff, as we truly felt like guests in their home. Throughout our five-day stay, they were exceptionally kind and helpful, assisting us with everything—from organizing excursions to arranging transportation to the airport.

A wonderful place with amazing people!
title: This hotel is perfect for those seeking a peaceful, cozy, and romantic getaway. Cleanliness and comfort, delicious food, and bea

ownerResponse/text:
Vielen Dank für Ihre Bewertung von Suite Lanka auf TripAdvisor. Der Spaziergang den Strand entlang nach Süden nach Dodanduwa ist ein schöner Start in den Tag und wie Sie sagen, ist es selbst in der Hochsaison nie überfüllt. Schwimmen ist bei ruhigem Wetter mit Vorsicht möglich, aber in den Gewässern Sri Lankas kann es an großen Teilen der Küste starke Strömungen geben und wir raten unseren Gästen, fünf Minuten den Strand hinauf zu schlendern und im Surfbereich zu schwimmen, der auch von Rettungsschwimmern bewacht wird und viel sicherer ist. Genießen Sie Ihre zukünftigen Reisen.
Mit freundlichen Grüßen
Das Team von Suite Lanka
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Wir sind mit dem TukTuk (3 Wheeler) angereist. Dieser ließ sich direkt vor dem Hoteleingang problemlos parken.
text:
Das Suite Lanka Hotel liegt direkt am langen Sandstrand.  Der Blick von den Zimmern / dem Garten auf den Strand/indischen Ozean war atemberaubend. 

Wir haben ein sehr schönes und geräumiges Deluxe-Zimmer im 1. Stock mit großem Balkon bewohnt. Der Service war immer freundlich und auf unsere Wünsche wurde schnell reagiert (der Hotelmanager Siri spricht sogar deutsch). Das a-la-Carte Frühstück ist bis 11:00 verfügbar - war gerade richtig für uns, so konnten wir vorher einen langen Strandspaziergang machen. 

Der Strand ist sehr breit und für die Hochsaison trotzdem wenig belebt. Baden ist möglich. Hohe Wellen und dadurch bedingt starke Strömungen erlauben aber wohl nur den Aufenthalt in Strandnähe.
title: Erholung am Strand

ownerResponse/text:

Nous pensons que nous sommes à une distance idéale des bars d'Hikkaduwa et comme vous le dites, il est agréable de se réveiller au son des vagues. Voyagez en toute sécurité.
Cordialement

text:
Very friendly service, good level of English spoken by the management.

Happy with the quality of our rooms, their size and position on the beach.

The hotel has tried to maintain it's Sri Lankan personality, which we appreciated.  For New Years Eve they put on a traditional Dragon Dance show, while the hotel next door had a covers band doing UK hits from 70's and 80's!

We thought that the Sri Lankan breakfast was good quality; curried eggs, coconut sambol, dal,  onion sambol all served with noodles and roti.  The manager came over and showed us how to eat the sweet chilli onion sambol as a jam with the roti.
title: Friendly Sri Lankan Hotel

text: Superb location directly on the gorgeous beach and away from the large crowds in central Hikkaduwa. The room was very spacious and comfortable, with balcony space for looking out to sea. The restaurant served excellent meals, especially the Sri Lankan curries and fried rice dishes, and sitting by the beach to eat was a real highlight. The staff were very friendly and looked after us really well.
title: Beautiful beach side stay in Hikkaduwa

ownerResponse/text:
Thank-you for reviewing Suite Lanka.We are thrilld that you have felt able to leave such a lovely review. Roshan really enjoyed his cocktail-making lesson. Have a happy Christmas from all of us.
Best regards
The Suite Lanka team
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Lovely laidback beach hotel on a beautiful long bay, an ideal first stop on my Sri Lanka tour for post-flight relaxation. The room was comfortable and clean with a secluded veranda overlooking the garden. Attentive, friendly staff and the wide selection of books and games elevated the stay above my expectations. I highly recommend dining in - their restaurant, Olin's, has the best food in the area. Happy Hour cocktails at Roshan's bar were another culinary highlight!
title: Incredible location, staff and food

ownerResponse/text:
Thank-you very much for your generous review of Suite Lanka. We are really intrigued that you preferred the smaller and cheaper ground-floor room! That has slightly confused us! We're pleased to that our staff helped to make your stay a happy one. We know that we are far from perfect, but we are very proud of our team's desire to provide a happy experience. Travel safely.
Best regards
The Suite Lanka team

roomTip: I would avoid turtle beach.  It is awful. The turtles looked like they were being attacked by loads of drunk tourists
text: We loved this place.  It is by far the best place on this beach. The rooms are fantastic.  We stayed five nights, three in the pent house and two on the bottom floor.  The penthouse is fabulous but we actually preferred the smaller ground floor (with a child easier for him to run about). The staff were brilliant, the food amazing. Altogether we loved it.
title: Fantastic gem, a must stay!

roomTip:

Homely feeling
text:
First stop in Sri Lanka after a long trip, I arrived at 6:50 am and the guard was waiting for me. I felt welcomed immediately by a friendly and professional staff. 
Mr Siri took extra care of me. :-)
David, the director is kind, helpful and reacted so fast to all of my questions previously to my stay. And I was lucky enough to meet him in Suite Lanka.

Perfectly situated, calm, delicious food, the whole place is super clean and the beach is beautiful. 
I do recommend the Sri Lankan breakfast… scrumptious! 
I slept like a baby on a brand new mattress. 
The pool area is cosy. 
I definitely recommend.
title: Suite Lanka : small clean pretty and great staff

ownerResponse/text:
Thank-you also to your family for being such enjoyable guests. That is a wonderful tribute which has filled the staff with a lot of pride and joy - a great boost to everyone as we prepare for high season! We are delighted that you found so much pleasure in your stay at Suite Lanka. We think our Penthouse Suite, in particular, is one of the great accommodation secrets on this pat of the coast!
Best regards
The Suite Lanka team
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
What an amazing experience! This hotel was everything we could have wished for and more. They reserved the whole upmost floor of the hotel for our family of five (two very large suites, one with our own bathtub with a view of the sea and a huge balcony adjoining the suites and overlooking the ocean and the beautiful sunsets). The staff was so helpful, attentive and friendly that it really made us feel welcome.
The hotel is small and you got to know all the other guests due to the friendly and cosy atmosphere. The breakfast that was served to the table had nice variety and the Sri Lankan breakfast was simply wonderful, so flavourful and very filling. The rooms were cleaned every day (great because of the sand that still found its way in even though our best efforts to prevent it), and they decorated our beds and sofa with fresh flowers each time.
The pool was great with the kids, and the fact that you can step right out of the hotel to the beach was simply amazing. It wasn't quite the season yet so it was rather quiet and tranquil in Hikkaduwa, which suited us perfectly. We went running on the beach in the morning, and the hotel provided yoga mats so I could do my morning yoga on the beach or on the balcony.
The hotel arranged our safari trip perfectly and they had auyrveda massage partner as well. They were very helpful with everything we could ask. 
We like to experience new restaurants and go out to dine, but this time we stayed and dined at the hotel quite a few times because the restaurant was just amazing and the service was so friendly. Everything, especially the seafood was superb and the pricing was very reasonable given the prices in Hikkaduwa in general. 
A warm recommendation and a big thank you for the staff who made our stay in Sri Lanka unforgettable!
title: What an amazing experience!

ownerResponse/text:
Vielen Dank für Ihre Bewertung von Suite Lanka. Wir freuen uns, dass Sie unsere Mitarbeiter auf einem guten Niveau finden. Seit wir einen neuen täglichen Poolreiniger gefunden haben – einen Behinderten aus der Gegend – glauben wir, dass unser Pool noch nie so gut war. Es stimmt, dass das Meer in fast ganz Sri Lanka außerhalb der Hochsaison rau sein und starke Strömungen aufweisen kann, sodass an vielen Teilen der Küste Vorsicht geboten ist. Der Turtle Beach, etwa 2 km von uns entfernt, ist die beste Option zum ruhigen Schwimmen. Wir wünschen Ihnen für die Zukunft viele schöne Feiertage.
beste grüße
Das Suite Lanka-Team
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:

We also booked in for spa treatments, and it was the best the staff were so professional and were able to help and give advice to help my shoulder and back pain. The best spa treatment I’ve ever had.

We would like to give a special shout out to the staff that took care of us: Dulshan, Feros, Ashan, Rasika, Damitn, Dananjaya and a special thanks to the Resident manager, Dinusha Goonasena for specially helping our family during our stay. 

We will definitely come back to the Occidental paradise and we can’t wait!

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you have a problem or query, you will find the staff members are very helpful.
text: This was a second visit, sadly both have been for just one night.  It is such a change to use an electric heater and not air conditioning (altitude is 1881 metres and so it is cool).  The area is known as Little England with many colonial buildings and that is really the style of the hotel.  It is lovely ... and the food, well, just say "Wow Factor"    I had a conversation with the manager, a very pleasant man, as are all the staff members.  One slight moan is that the room televisions do not get BBC World and most of our hotels on the island did.
title: A luxurious and stylish expreience.

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
A remarkable and outstanding hotel, situated in one of the highest (and coolest) villages in Sri Lanka.  The rooms were large and commodious, the decor is traditional but not dated and the beds huge and ultra comfortable. 
The service is even higher than the normal excellent attention you get in this country. The food is done in a kitchen open to view, and was among the best we've ever had anywhere, let alone in Sri Lanka. Can't really recommend this place highly enough!!
title: An outstanding hotel experience!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Thank you for your continued support and for taking the time to share such a thoughtful review. We’re truly grateful to hear that each of your visits to Jetwing Lighthouse has been consistently memorable. Your kind words about the authenticity of our Sri Lankan cuisine and the care our team puts into both preparation and service mean a great deal to us. 

We're especially glad you enjoy dining with a view of the sea. It’s one of our favorite touches too, particularly at sunset. Your recommendation is deeply appreciated, and we look forward to welcoming you back for many more memorable meals in the future. 

Ayubowan! (May you live long) 

Indika Gamage 
Head of Galle Hotels 
Jetwing Lighthouse
placeInfo/address: 433 A Dadella, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I visited Jetwing Lighthouse for dinner in February, and as always, it was a truly memorable experience. Having dined here multiple times over the years — breakfast, lunch, and dinner — I can confidently say the consistency in quality and service is exceptional.

The Sri Lankan cuisine is rich, authentic, and beautifully prepared, making it a must-visit for food lovers, especially locals seeking refined traditional flavors. Prices are very reasonable considering the premium setting.

One of my favorite parts? You can choose a table overlooking the sea, which adds an extra layer of magic to the meal — especially at sunset.

The staff are warm, attentive, and genuinely welcoming. I highly recommend Jetwing Lighthouse for anyone looking to indulge in great food with stunning views and top-tier service
title: A Favorite Spot for Memorable Meals by the Ocean

placeInfo/address: 433 A Dadella, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
最高の体験でした！マスターシェフのNalineさん、バトラーヘッドのImashaさん、パティスリーシェフに、その他シェフの皆さんがつきっきりでスリランカカレーの極意を教えてくれます。
最初は市場に行って食べたい食材を選び、その後下処理はホテル側で行ってくれ、レストランで海を見ながら料理をした後、貸切のレストランで作った料理を堪能できます！！スリランカカレーはとてもおいしく、この旅のハイライトになりました。
100% recommend!
title: cooking session

ownerResponse/text:
Hi Ashwin,

Thank you so much for taking the time to share your kind words following your recent wedding celebrations at Colombo Court Hotel & Spa.

It was truly our honour and pleasure to be part of such a special and meaningful occasion. We are delighted to hear that both you and your guests had a memorable experience with us, from the cultural and religious festivities to the decor, service, and overall ambiance.

I’m especially grateful for your appreciation of our coordination efforts. Ensuring that every detail ran smoothly and that your expectations were met was a top priority for us, and I’m glad to know that our presence and support made a difference throughout the events.

We’re thrilled to hear that the decor exceeded expectations, the drinks were flowing, and most importantly, that the food was a highlight for everyone. I will personally pass along your compliments to our Executive Chef and his culinary team; they will be delighted to know that their hard work has been recognised and appreciated.

Thank you once again for placing your trust in us during such a significant milestone. It means a great deal to the entire team. On behalf of all of us here at Colombo Court Hotel & Spa, we wish you and Shantal a lifetime of love, joy, and beautiful memories, and we hope to welcome you back again, perhaps to celebrate many anniversaries to come!

Warm regards,
The Colombo Court Hotel & Spa Family
placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: Thank you so much for all your help in accommodating guests for our wedding as well as religious/cultural and festivities. Your support was gratefully appreciated. You were always quick to respond to my emails and you had constant presence in the venue to make sure the events went on smoothly. The guests totally appreciated and were in awe of all the decor and service in the hotel. The food was exceptional. Kudos to the chef. The drinks were flowing. All in all we were very happy with the hotel and more importantly of your service and support

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
From beautifully proportioned rooms to open air spaces, the hotel stands a s aven of tranquility minutes away from the busting heart of the city. What used to be 3 houses alongside Colombo main road was metamorphosed into a boutique hotel. Though multi storey constructions have since sprouted out of the ground by the Galle green, the Colombo Court standa as a witness of the intricate balance of Colombo spirit ,: between offshore influences, lush nature and climate and bustling energy of the Sri Lankan people, it reflects urban tropical modernism in a applied acception.
Once checked-in  never to be forgotten. Mishfa and Mohammed at the reception are more family than hosts. Always keen to keep in touch and assist with additional support.
title: In Colombo cultural epicenter

roomTip: Be careful when crossing roads as it can be tricky dye to the traffic. Enjoy the library at colombo court as there is a variety of books
text: Colombo court and spa hotel was fabulous. A truly exotic experience. Lush green courtyards. Spacious rooms. King size comfortable bed. Air-conditioning was excellent. Lovely washroom with a big bath. Staff was exceptionally welcoming especially Deen, hanfal and manuka. I loved the full body aromatherapy massage at the amber spa given by an Indonesian lady sudharmi. She was professional and I felt relaxed even though spa was simple and small. The food at the roof top cloud cafe was delicious. Compliments to the chef! The breakfast platters served at the poolside cafe were good especially the srilankan platter. The water temperature in the pool was perfect. Jacuzzi offered a cool dip. It is not a hot jacuzzi as summer time it is hot outside. Location was perfect as the marino mall is only a 7 minute walk and it offers a variety of halal restaurants serving srilsnkan, far eastern, Chinese and Arabic food. Meat served at colombo court is halal too .
title: A truly exotic and memorable first visit

A good alternative to faceless five star hotels and a novelty in such a good location

placeInfo/address: 433 Galle Road Colombo 03, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
**Excellent Stay at Mandarina Colombo – Exceptional Service!**  

My mother and I had an amazing stay at Mandarina Colombo, and we couldn’t be happier with the service we received. From the moment we arrived late at night, Pubudu and Rehan made check-in seamless and welcoming, ensuring we were comfortable after a long journey. Similarly, during our late-night checkout, they made the process just as smooth.  

A special thank you to Leon, who went above and beyond to help us plan our 3-day itinerary. His insights and recommendations truly made our trip memorable, and we appreciated his patience and local knowledge.  

The hotel itself was fantastic—clean, comfortable, and in a great location. The staff’s warmth and professionalism made all the difference, and we highly recommend Mandarina Colombo to anyone visiting Sri Lanka. Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable!
title: **Exceptional Service and Comfortable Stay at Mandarina Colombo

text: Es ist ein super nettes Hotel in einer top Strandlage. Die Zimmer sind groß und das Bett bequem. Besonders gut fanden wir, dass direkt ein Baldachin am Bett angebracht war gegen die Mücken. placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
Wunderschönes kleines Hotel direkt am Strand mit einem traumhaften Blick aufs Meer. Die Atmosphäre ist familiär und warmherzig, die Mitarbeiter alle super freundlich und besonders Siri liest einem gefühlt jeden Wunsch von den Augen ab und organisiert was immer man möchte. Auf ihn ist Verlass und es macht Freude, sich zu unterhalten. Es scheint, er ist mit voller Leidenschaft dabei.
Das Essen und die frischen Säfte waren köstlich und es war jeden Tag eine Freude, all die Palmenhörnchen und Flughunde vom Garten aus beobachten zu können.
Einen halben Punkt Abzug geben wir dafür, dass unser Zimmer etwas modrig gerochen hat, sonst war es aber wunderschön und mit Liebe dekoriert und eingerichtet, das Bett mit Moskitoschutz war sehr bequem und wir haben fantastisch geschlafen.
title: Traumhaft

roomTip: The hotel staff will arrange airport transfers for you, so just ask. They use a reputable company and excellent drivers.
text:
This is a little gem of a hotel! The location is beautiful - absolute beach front with the sounds of waves 24/7. You can eat right beside the beach for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The rooms are colonial style with loads of character which we love. Very clean and tidy. Comfy beds too. 
Nothing was too much trouble, the staff are so friendly and accomodating. The food is delicious and the breakfast selection perfect. Make sure you order their Sri Lankan style breakfast the night before if you want that as an option. We ended up eating here most evenings too because it was so good. 
The pool is a good size and always clean, we enjoyed cooling off a few times in it after a hot day browsing the Hikkaduwa area. 
They even have a super friendly onsite dog and although there are a few stray dogs around (typical for this part of Sri Lanka) even they are super friendly and delightful company! We wish we could have brought one in particular home with us, he was such a gentle natured boy. 
Price is very reasonable we think, you wont regret staying here. 
Just a note that the beach isn't safe for swimming, but just being right on the beach is so beautiful you wont miss the ocean dip - just use the pool instead or go for a swim at nearby Turtle Bay.
title: A little gem in Hikkaduwa - and beach front perfection!

ownerResponse/text:
That is such an uplifting review! We might print it out and stick it on the wall of the office to cheer us up on tough days. We are thrilled that we have provided such an enjoyable experience and that you did not regret your third visit. You will always be very welcome.
Best regards
The Suite Lanka team
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Take care if you wish to swim in the sea out of season there are strong under currents during this period even strong swimmers are at risk.
text:
This is one of my favourite hotels and locations to visit anywhere in the world. I enjoy Suite Lanka so much that I have now stayed here 3 times over the last 10 years……and I plan to return many more times. 

The fact that it is a small boutique hotel means that it is always quiet even when fully booked. The staff are so kind, attentive and friendly making the effort to get to know you personally. 

The facilities are just what you need to relax and soak up the amazing beach scenery. 

The restaurant Olins is incredible with fresh and tasty options made in a clean and professional environment. I would highly recommend the Sri Lankan breakfast and the Sri Lankan curries as my personal favourites, although there are multiple other tasty options. The food was so good that I would return to the hotel for meals regularly and only ate out a handful of times. 

The beach view is incredible from all the rooms.
title: A gem of a hotel with everything you could ask for to enjoy a relaxed stay

ownerResponse/text: Thank-you for your considered review of Suite Lanka. Reviews on tripadvisor are really helpful for us. With a five-week stay, you had a lot of experiences to compare us to! We are pleased that things went so well and we wish you many happy holidays in the future.

text: We have been travelling Sri Lanka for 5 weeks & I have to say this has been the best place we have stayed down to beautiful rooms - food is amazing and staff. text:
Absolutely loved this hotel!

Just finished a whistle stop tour of Sri Lanka.  9 hotels in 14 days ranging from small boutiques to large complexes and this was arguably my favorite of the lot!

We stayed in the Pool room which as the name suggests had access to both the pool and the beach. Plenty of room for 2 teens and 2 adults and very tastefully furnished.

A wonderful Sri Lankan breakfast (easily the best breakfast of my trip). Nice bar area and pool also which the kids enjoyed.

However,  its the staff that really make this venue. Friendly, cheerful, helpful. They are everything the hospitality trade should be.

This is a little gem of a hotel!
title: One night stay at Suite Lanka

placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: This is a boutique hotel with some large rooms.  We had the pool suite room which had a seperate lounge room then the bedroom had a four post bed with netting and the decore was quite funky almost a tuscany feel to it.  Being a small hotel there was only our group and another two couples for dinner so there was a bit of rearranging for the dinner table for our group.  The meal we had was the best meal we had in our time in Sri Lanka.  We called out the Chefs and gave them the biggest praising clap and hooray for their efforts.   The rooms were clean and large with a view of the beach which at the time had crashing waves and lots of rain.  It was great to fall asleep to.  The bed was really comfortable.  Another beach venue we would revisit.
title: Suite Lanka should be named Sweet Lanka - really lovely.

ownerResponse/text:
Many thanks for your informative Tripadvisor review. We fully agree with ou that our prices are unexpectedly low (joke)! Seriously, it was good to read that you enjoyed the mood of the hotel and that the enthusiasm of our staff, and the quality of the restaurant, made your stay extra special. Thanks for trusting Suite Lanka for some of your Sri Lanka holiday and we wish you many happy travels in the future.
Best regards
The Suite Lanka team
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
This place is amazing, but it would be nothing without the staff who really made our stay special. Nothing is too much trouble for them, they are both friendly, helpful and hard working, always on hand to help with any little thing, even if it is just local travel advice. The deputy manager Kumarasiri was especially friendly and made sure our every need was met.
The room was huge an easily accomodated the four of us, we had the pool suite which opened on both sides, to the pool and also the beachfront garden, where you can dine, use the sunbeds or just relax on a sofa and read, that's if you don't want to sit on your large balcony.
The beds were very comfortable and the 4-poster in the main room was huge. everything was provided in the bathroom, loads of towels, shampoo, conditioner, soap, shower gel.
The restaurant and dining were fabulous, breakfast has a range of options from traditional Sri Lankan breakfast with sambal and rice to continential or cooked, loads of fresh fruit and juice, and of course tea, it wouldn't be Sri Lanka without Ceylon tea. Evening meals were fabulous, we ate there most nights, very reasonable pricing for such tasty and feshly cooked food, i particularly enjoyed the black pork curry and my kids loved the fried noodles and fried rice.
Our kids loved the pool area, it's secluded and sheltered, right next to the rooms and the pool bar.
The hotel itself is secured at night and has a permanent security guard once the staff go home, the guard is a lovely fellow, constantly patrolling and keeping an eye out which is very reassurring. 
One day we had to leave to go to the temple at a very early hour of 5am, so the hotel prepared us packed breakfasts (which they didn't have to do) and the security guard made sure we had them ready for when we left.
I cannot reccomend this place more highly, out of the 5 places we stayed in Sri Lanka, from east to west coast, this was the highlight and the best accomodation experience, it way exceeeded my expectations, especially given the very cheap price, i would not have expected somewhere so good at such a low price per night for 4 people.
title: An amazing colonial-style boutique hotel with fabulous staff and facilities

ownerResponse/text:
We are thrilled that we met your hopes for a rewarding relaxation after your mighty cycle ride around the island. Your comments about our restaurant are really appreciated and I'm sure that Kumarasiri will be uplifted that you found his service so thoughtful. All in all, your review has given us a lot to smile about - if you visit again get in touch with us and we'll do our best to sort out that Penthouse Suite for you!
Best regards
The Suite Lanka team
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
Recently back from wonderful 5 night stay at this lovely hotel after cycling around the island.

The hotel is immaculate which is a credit to all the staff who work to ensure our stay was perfect not just from cleaning the room daily but those cheerful staff who keep the grounds so clean everyday.

The breakfast options are perfect, I would highly recommend the homemade muesli, it was delicious.  We opted to try the evening meals, this was absolutely superb, the quality and taste of the food was incredible, and was beautifully presented that we decided to eat at the restaurant every evening throughout our stay.

A special shout out to Kumarisir (I think that’s how you spell it) he was so welcoming on our arrival, ensured everything was perfect,  and always remembered what we had to drink.

We would definitely return to Suite Lanka and hopefully have the opportunity to stay in the Penthouse Suite.
title: Wonderful Hotel and amazing food

The Suite Lanka team
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
Wow! What a wonderful time we had at this superb little hotel! From the moment we landed to the moment we left, we were made to feel so welcome and comfortable! It was almost as we were staying in a house with family members!!
When we arrived we were given a deliciously cold fruit drink and a wet cloth to refresh from Siri and his excellent team! Our room was beautiful, clean and huge with spectacular sea views!
Excellent shower and plenty of hot water!
The restaurant, sunloungers and the sea were just down the stairs, approx 20m away from us - it was just like paradise!
Breakfast was excellent - and in particular the banana and chocolate sauce pancakes - delicious!! Food was excellent - rice and curry, devilled chicken and the kebab - we hardly got through the vast menu during our 4 day stay! Our 5:30 cocktails made by Siri - a different one every day, was a lovely aperitif before dinner!
Excellent clean pool too!!
I would like to thank Siri in particular who looked after us so well! His English is excellent and he is so kind, intelligent and friendly- as were all the staff!
Thank you Suite Lanka - we will never forget you!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!
title: Superb, fabulous, wonderful!

ownerResponse/text:
Many thanks for taking the trouble to review Suite Lanka. We are pleased that you had such a happy and relaxing time with us and met up with some old friends. Thanks for coming to see us!
Best regards
The Suite Lanka team
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay at least for 2 nights.
text:
I stayed at Suite Lanka with friends for a quick getaway from Colombo, and it exceeded our expectations. Despite being off-season, with many cafes and restaurants closed, the location was perfect. The beautiful beach was ideal for walks, and the area was pleasantly quiet.

We stayed on the top floor with a direct sea view. The room was massive, very comfortable beds, with writing table and sofa and it was like having our own apartment, complete with a big bathroom with a tub and a spacious common area. The Sri Lankan breakfast was fantastic, especially the dara poranu paang, a rare treat on the island. The club sandwich we had was delicious too.

The staff were extremely friendly and always ready to take pictures for us. We were allowed to check in early with no extra charge, which was great. The pool area was lovely and very photogenic. Our only regret was staying just one night; we wished we could have stayed at least two.
title: Amazing Stay at Suite Lanka

text:
Very enjoyable stay. I was there for an aggregate of 5 nights in two stints. Each stay was a joy. The rooms were extremely well fitted, smart and comfortable. Reception, Housekeeping and Room Service were warm, friendly, helpful and efficient. 

Some quibbles: 
1. The Deluxe Room during my first stint had two odd cement blocks right in the middle of the room blocking view of the TV from almost all angles. 
2. Some work needs to be done on the Menu. The choice of soups is limited and unimaginative. For a coastal hotel, fish options are slender. Further, one had expected the Menu to have a set Sri Lankan meal, vegetarian and non-vegetarian.
3. The Spa is closed on Wednesdays, the only day I had for a look-in. Staff may rotate but a hotel of this size should not have off-days.
title: It's the people that make a place

placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Phenomenal stay. The room was very comfortable and the garden suite was perfect for our family. Our daughter had plenty of room for herself upstairs and we had some privacy downstairs. The porch was such a bonus…sitting there in the breeze was so relaxing. 

The grounds are very well kept. The pool is gorgeous and super clean. Be sure to ask for cushions for the chairs. 

The food was delicious. We got half board and ate breakfast and dinner here. The array of desserts is amazing. All of the staff is friendly and ready to help. 

As a bonus, there’s lots of beautiful wildlife here. On the way to check out this morning I saw langurs and an orange kitty. We also saw macaques, peacocks, and lots of cute dogs. 

I highly recommend the Occidental Paradise Dambulla.
title: Marvelous stay!

We recently stayed at Occidental Paradise Dambulla for a romantic escape, and it truly exceeded our expectations. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with warm hospitality and a peaceful, lush atmosphere that set the perfect tone for our stay.

The property is beautifully nestled amidst greenery, offering a serene and private ambiance that's ideal for couples. Our room was spacious, clean, and elegantly designed with a touch of traditional charm. We especially loved the private balcony that opened up to scenic views — perfect for quiet mornings with coffee or a peaceful evening under the stars.

title: Interesting experience

placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Occidental Paradise in Dambulla on the second day of our road trip, and it was nothing short of magical. This resort really lives up to its name: it's a paradise for families, nature lovers, and anyone who needs some peace and quiet in nature.

We were warmly welcomed as soon as we got there. Oh, it was unforgettable: it was traditional, elegant, and felt personal. It was amazing that they put a sash around our necks, which we got to keep as a nice keepsake. I think Team Occidental truly lives up to hospitality. 

The chalets were big and well-kept, and they were comfortable because they were in a beautiful natural setting. We loved waking up to the sound of birds and seeing peacocks walking around the grounds. It was like living in a nature documentary!

The pool area was great because it had separate areas for adults and kids. Our kids had a great time. Another great thing was the in-room dining. It was tasty, easy, and served with care.

There was a lot of food, it was different, and it was all very good. There was food for everyone, from local favorites to kid-friendly choices.

But the hospitality was what really stood out. We've stayed at a lot of places, but this team was the best. The Resident Manager and the General Manager both came to see us in person, which was a rare and nice gesture that made us feel very important. Thanks a lot to Ashan and the rest of the team for going above and beyond.

If you’re ever heading to Dambulla, Occidental Paradise should be on your must-visit list. It's more than just a hotel; it's the best way to experience Sri Lankan hospitality, nature, and warmth.

Special thanks to Ruwan (group accounts manager) for helping me out with the last-minute reservation. 

Kushan Amarasinghe, family traveler, suites & chalets reviewer.
title: A Veritable Treasure in Dambulla: Natural Beauty, Warm Hospitality, and Treasured Memories

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for sharing your valuable feedback. We're delighted to know that your overnight stay was comfortable and that you appreciated the early check-in at no extra charge, as well as the convenience of a late check-out. It's wonderful to hear that you enjoyed your meal at the poolside restaurant, and we're glad the dishes were satisfying.

We sincerely apologize for your less-than-ideal dining experience at the rooftop terrace. Your comments regarding portion sizes and taste are noted, and we will review this with our culinary team to ensure better value and quality moving forward.

We’re also pleased to hear that you found our hotel and rooms well-maintained, and that the comfortable beds contributed to a good night’s sleep. However, we regret that the jacuzzis were unavailable during your stay. We understand this may have been disappointing, and we’ll work on minimizing such inconveniences in the future.

Your observations regarding staff attentiveness are appreciated. While our goal is to provide attentive service, we will ensure that it does not come across as overbearing.

Thank you again for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. It helps us improve and enhance the experiences we offer. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back for an even better stay in the future.

Warm regards,
The Colombo Court Hotel & Spa Family!
placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir hatten eine Übernachtung am Ende unseres Urlaubs hier. 
Wir bekamen ein anderes Zimmer als geplant welches sehr komfortabel war und wir konnten ohne Aufpreis etwas früher einchecken. Wir machten einen Late Check out um 15 Uhr da unser Flug erst abends ging was ca 20 Euro kostete. 

Danach aßen wir noch etwas im Pool Restaurant was sehr lecker war und auch ausreichend und preislich noch ok ( Pizza Margarita & Biriyani). Am Abend zuvor wurden wir zum Essen nach oben auf die Dachterrasse geschickt. Die Portionen waren sehr klein und der Preis umso höher und geschmacklich war’s das leider nicht wert. 
Das Personal war sehr freundlich, teilweise vllt etwas überambitioniert, man kam sich oft beobachtet vor. 
Das Hotel und die Zimmer sind sehr gepflegt. Die Betten wirklich bequem sodass wir gut schliefen .
Leider waren die Jacuzzis geschlossen, der Pool aber geöffnet.
title: Eine entspannte Nacht zum Abschluss

text:
it was my first trip to Sri Lanka, I chose a place I thought had a good location.  

The hotel had a pool, the rooms were truly beautiful, and every detail—especially the spacious bathroom—was just perfect. It was such a cute hotel, and I was very satisfied.  

Although there was a bit of trouble along the way, they made sure to follow up thoroughly until the end.  

I was especially impressed by a young and charming staff member named Masfah, who took care of us until the very last moment to make sure we had no problems.  

There were also spas, delicious restaurants, cafes, and supermarkets nearby, so I was extremely satisfied with my stay.
title: The location is great, stylish, and incredibly comfortable, and the staff is friendly.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you so much for sharing your delightful experience with us! We are thrilled to hear that your stay at Colombo Court Hotel & Spa was a memorable and positive conclusion to your Sri Lankan adventure.

It’s heartwarming to know that you enjoyed your upgraded room and its luxurious features, including the canopy bed, spacious bath, and wraparound balcony. Your excitement truly resonates with our efforts to create a unique and inviting atmosphere for our guests.

We're equally pleased that you appreciated the pool and rooftop bar, as well as our carefully curated menu. It’s wonderful to hear that our breakfast pastries stood out for you—it’s always our goal to bring a touch of excellence to every detail.

Vihan, Hanfal, and Mark will be delighted to know that their service left such a positive impression. Our team takes great pride in making every guest feel welcomed and valued.

Regarding the government tax and service charge, we truly understand your surprise. These charges are set by the Sri Lankan government, and while we must adhere to these regulations, we regret any inconvenience it caused. Your understanding in this matter is greatly appreciated.

Thank you once again for choosing to stay with us and for taking the time to share your kind words. It was a pleasure to host you, and we hope to welcome you back on your next visit to Colombo!

Warm regards,
The Colombo Court Hotel & Spa Family!
placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
After a 2 week tour of Sri Lanka, I had an extra night in Colombo by myself. As it was only one night I wasn’t fussed about where the agent booked so I didn’t even google before arriving at Colombo Court. 
This place is spectacular when you know what you’re getting, imagine my delight when I’d been expecting a room with bed. 

 Vihan, Hanfal and Mark met us at reception and provided exemplary service. I received a free room upgrade and squealed with delight upon seeing the canopy bed, ginormous bath and the wrap around balcony. It was all stunning. 

The pool is gorgeous and the rooftop bar has been done to a really high spec. The whole experience felt like we’d stepped into a hidden oasis in the middle of the bustling noise of Colombo. 

The menu was also excellent. Benefit of being a city, they have figured out how to do breakfast pastries properly. This is notable because all the local breads we’d had to date, all tended to be on the sweet side (no matter if there is fish or onion within).

I did get whacked with an unexpected and sizeable government tax/service charge on some wine which was almost 25% of the total bill. This hasn’t happened anywhere else in Sri Lanka so it was a bit of a shock (10% service charge was the norm in the more built up touristy areas). But hey ho. The room and facilities are what I’ll be remembering for a long time to come.
title: Excellent experience, gorgeous room

roomTip: We had room 211 and it was lovely and spacious with a big bathroom.
text:
Fantastic friendly staff, very attentive. The exterior looks a little old and tired and it’s right on the main drag meaning it’s quite noisy but once you get inside it’s calm and refreshing and it’s a retreat from the hustle and bustle of the city. The pleasant pool and breakfast areas are in a lovely calming area surrounded by trees and is a lovely little oasis.
There is a very good selection of both western and local foods for breakfast and the staff go out of their way to be helpful and genuinely welcoming to make it a pleasant experience. There is a spa and gym as well as a spa retreat.
All up a lovely couple of days spent in this hotel.
title: 2 nights in Colombo

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest, 

Thank you for sharing your experience following your recent stay at Colombo Court Hotel & Spa. We are delighted to hear that you found your stay comfortable and that our team members—Vihan, Sanjith, and Mark—made it truly memorable with their outstanding service. We will be sure to pass along your kind words to them, as they take great pride in delivering exceptional guest experiences.

We are also pleased that you appreciated the spaciousness of your room and the overall atmosphere of our property. However, we deeply regret the inconvenience caused by the mosquitoes in your room and the absence of mosquito nets. Please know that your feedback is invaluable to us, and we are already working on measures to address this issue and ensure a more comfortable stay for our guests in the future.

Thank you once again for choosing to stay with us and for highlighting both the positives and areas where we can improve. It was our pleasure to host you, and we hope to welcome you back for an even more enjoyable stay in the future.

Warm regards,
The Colombo Court Hotel & Spa Management
placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: The outstanding service from Vihan, Sanjith, and Mark made my stay truly memorable. The room impressed with its generous size. However, the absence of mosquito nets, combined with numerous mosquitoes in the room, was the only drawback in an otherwise perfect stay. Despite this minor issue the exceptional staff and spacious accommodation make this hotel a worthy choice.
title: Comfortable stay in the capital

text:
Overall, the service was excellent. The staff—Daham, Rasika, Thanuj, Ishan, Ayesha, Alkila, and Chef Deepal—were incredibly friendly and hospitable, making the stay truly enjoyable. Excellent service all around.

The food was delicious and well-prepared. Special thanks to Chef Deepal and the team for the wonderful dining experience.

Just a small suggestion: it would be great to have a charging pad for electronics as well as a wall adapter and an iron available in the room, so guests don’t have to request them separately.

placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel's rooms, swimming pool and recreational areas are very spacious. The buffets had excellent spread from Western to Chinese to Local dishes including lot of local fruit varieties. Credit to Chef Mr. Fernando. 

A good place to do recreational activities and some adventure activities. Mr. Darshana and Mr. Saman were really good and attentive. The Spa was also good.  

Very close proximity to Sigiriya, Dambulla and National Parks like Minneriya, Kaudulla and Hurulu. 

Ancient cities like Anuradhapura and Polonnaruwa is about 60-90 minutes' drive from the hotel. 

Suggestion
Request to put a twin or proper double beds to upper deck of the duplex units as that will be more comfortable to accommodate 4-5 member family. The units have enough space surely. Just give a thought about it. 

Thank you, Occidental Dambulla Team for Facilitating Great Vacation for my family
title: Good Value for Money

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
I stayed at Ramada Hotel in Seeduwa for one night as a transit passenger, and it was a comfortable and hasslefree experience. The hotel is located very close to Bandaranaike International Airport, which makes it an ideal choice for travelers with early flights or layovers.

The check-in process was quick and smooth, and the staff were polite. The room was clean, quiet, and equipped with all the basic amenities needed for a short stay, including a comfortable bed, air conditioning, Wi-Fi, and a private bathroom with hot water.

The hotel offers a restaurant with a decent selection of meals and snacks, which was convenient after a long journey. I also appreciated the airport shuttle service, which was punctual and saved me the stress of finding transportation.

Though it’s mainly a transit hotel, Ramada Seeduwa maintains good standards in cleanliness and service.
title: Can have a peaceful sleep for a exhausted person
